Notes: Smooth and ripe, floral and spicy in character, this Napa red displays tiers of juicy plum, blackberry and black cherry flavors that are complex and vibrant. Quite appealing now; will be even better with cellaring. Best from 2001 through 2007. 8,200 cases made. —JL

Deep, dark ruby with intense aromas of mint, berries and currants. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a delicious ripe fruit and lead-pencil aftertaste. Very fine indeed. Typically outstanding for Lynch-Bages. Best after 2005. 35,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Bodegas y Viñedos Alion Ribera del Duero Reserva +
Notes: This modern-style red shows plenty of toasty vanilla flavors up front, but there's a solid core of ripe blackberry and black cherry, too. The texture is plush, but crisp acidity keeps the wine lively. It's a polished, impressive mix of suppleness and weight. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made. —TM

Marvelous aromas of raspberry, coconut and mineral. Full-bodied, with superbly well-integrated yet powerful tannins. Chewy and fruity finish. Needs a lot of time to mellow. Much better than the barrel samples I tasted. Best Pichon-Baron since 1990. Best after 2006. 25,000 cases made. —JS

Plenty of ripe, fresh fruit in this red, with flavors of black cherries, blackberries and plums, along with accents of toast and coffee. Yet it remains smooth and graceful on the palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruity finish. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made. —TM

Bubbling over with blackberry, cherry and spice, with a hint of coconut. Full-bodied and chewy, yet refined and well manicured. A silky texture that goes on and on. Big and tannic wine. A super effort from Poujeaux. Best after 2001. 24,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Fattoria di Felsina Chianti Classico Berardenga +
Notes: Just as expected from Felsina: a superb Chianti Classico, displaying lots of cherry, berry and wet earth character. The wine is medium-bodied, with medium, silky tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2001. 13,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard Tapestry Reserve Napa Valley +
Notes: Tight in structure while plush in texture, offering rich plum, dark chocolate, cinnamon, spice and earth flavors that linger deliciously on the long, complex finish--this is one seductive California red. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2005. 14,500 cases made. —JL

An enticing California Chardonnay with a complex flavor profile of rich fig, pear, hazelnut and citrus couched in a smooth and creamy texture. A short term in the cellar should add the finishing touches. Drink now through 2003. 39,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Domaine Clavel Coteaux du Languedoc La Copa Santa +
Notes: Quite a mouthful. Dense and incredibly concentrated, with layers of complex yet well-defined flavors of bacon, dark chocolate, ripe plum and raspberry, finishing with mineral and coffeelike notes. Rather plush despite its power, but this French red will need time in the cellar to integrate even further. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,167 cases made. —KM

Wine: The Hess Collection Chardonnay Napa Valley +
Notes: Bright and inviting, the lively intensity of the complex grapefruit, melon, pear and spice flavors is nicely balanced by a frame of pretty toast and cedary oak in this outstanding California white. Drink now through 2003. 30,000 cases made. —JL

Wow. This is a richly concentrated, deftly made Chardonnay that's packed with ripe fruit flavors and layered with creamy, spicy accents that linger on the finish. Full-bodied, almost sweet in its ripeness, but still balanced. Drink now through 2001. 3,500 cases made. —

The best Cantemerle in years, beautiful and rich, with a wonderful core of fruit. Pretty plum and berry aromas, with hints of tobacco and chocolate, lead to a full-bodied wine with loads of chocolate and berry character. Long, long aftertaste. Best after 2005. 22,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: King Estate Pinot Gris Oregon Reserve +
Notes: A lovely white, smooth and round on the palate, delivering a generous portion of melon, spicy pear and caramel flavors that linger beautifully, drawing you back for another sip. Drink now. 4,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Elvio Cogno Dolcetto d'Alba Vigna del Mandorlo +
Notes: A Dolcetto of the highest level. Full-bodied, coating the palate with well-integrated tannins as well as mocha, chocolate and mostly black cherry and tar. For this varietal, there's amazing richness on the opulent finish. Tastes unfiltered. A perfect forebear of what the great '98 vintage might bring us. Drink now through 2001. 1,084 cases made. —PM

Wine: Balthasar Ress Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Hattenheimer Schützenhaus +
Notes: Authoritative, with a hint of a swagger, but this never loses focus. Shows peach aromas and flavors, but with more smoke and mineral, married to a rich texture and a firm backbone. Fine length of flavor. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri Rioja +
Winery: La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri
Notes: This ambitious red from Spain has a deep, opaque color, deep, almost charred aromas of coffee and toast and is firmly tannic on the palate, with ripe flavors of coffee, plum, prune and licorice. The wood notes are dominant now, but it has the concentration to improve with age. Best after 2002. 23,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Scharzhofberger +
Notes: Seductive, bursting with succulent lime and apricot aromas and flavors accented by white pepper. In the mouth, it's rich and racy until the refreshing acidity ushers in a long, multidimensional finish. Great stuff. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made. —BS

Plenty of blackberry, currant and cherry character. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, fruity aftertaste. A mellow and well-defined '96. One of the best Issans in ages. Best after 2000. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Mumm Cuvée Napa DVX Napa Valley +
Notes: A refreshing style of bubbly, with pretty citrus, apple, hazelnut and pear notes. The structure is focused and firm, showing elegance and depth and offering both bright acidity and creamy texture. Long finish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made. —
Wonderfully rich and silky, with polished, focused pear, nectarine and toast, showing more nuances of flavor on the finish. Drink now. 21,300 cases made. —JL

Wine: Sanford Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County +
Notes: A ripe, supple and harmonious red with an attractive range of plum, dried cherry, anise, sage and spice, holding its focus and bowing out with a long, rich aftertaste. Very impressive--among the best of the '97 California Pinots. Drink now through 2006. 8,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Dr. Bürklin-Wolf Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Forster +
Notes: Gorgeous. Exhibiting peach, violet and tropical fruit nuances, this white is concentrated and solidly supported by bracing acidity and power that carries through the finish. Young and unevolved, this shows great potential. Best from 2001 through 2008. 1,200 cases made. —BS

Wine: Georges Duboeuf Pouilly-Fuissé Aged in Oak +
Notes: Lively, racy and full-bodied, this white Burgundy is packed with deftly created oak accents, showing a pronounced toasted character along with plenty of lemon notes, good fruit and impressive length on the finish. It's tempting now, but worth cellaring short-term. Best from 2000 through 2005. 5,000 cases made. —PM

Ripe, lively and remarkably elegant and refined, this has distinctive herb- and cedar-scented currant and raspberry flavors that keep spilling over on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made. —HS

Ripe and spicy, here's a generous and focused red from Australia, dripping with blackberry, black cherry, anise and leather flavors that keep pumping through the long finish. Its fine tannins can use cellaring. Best after 2001. 5,000 cases made. —HS

A lush and deep red from Spain, with ripe fruit flavors of blackberry and cassis, rich notes of chocolate and toast from new oak and a muscular structure that remains balanced and approachable through the long, spicy finish. A fine example of modern Rioja, it's also a good buy at this price and score. Drink now through 2006. 9,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Renzo Masi Toscana Erta e China +
Notes: A pretty, balanced Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Intriguing aromas of plum skin and fresh mushroom have a hint of flowers. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a fruity, minty aftertaste. Best after 2000. 3,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Wolfberger Riesling Alsace Cuvée des Seigneurs +
Notes: Aromas and flavors of forest floor, mineral and lanolin are allied to a sleek, steel-plated structure in this impressive Alsace Riesling. Dry, rich and intense, the wine combines freshness and some mature elements that should develop nicely. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: David Bruce Pinot Noir Central Coast +
Notes: Smooth, rich and polished, with a complex core of herb-laced black cherry, currant, plum and raspberry flavors that soar on the finish, this California red offers an attractive combination of high quality and reasonable price, should be fairly available, too. Best from 2000 through 2004. 14,000 cases made. —JL
Smooth, polished and refreshing for its juicy pineapple, citrus and vanilla-almond flavors that wrap up neatly on the silky finish. Drink now through 2004. 8,000 cases made. —HS

Delicious from start to finish, this gorgeous white bursts with ripe peach, smoke, nut and citrus character. Complex, fresh and beautifully balanced, this is textbook Alsace, a perfect introduction to the region. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made. —BS

Dark ruby in color, with extremely ripe raisin and spice aromas. Full-bodied and very chewy, with loads of polished tannins and a long, long finish that's big and fruity. A solid, muscular red fromTuscany, this is the greatest Solaia ever made. Best after 2004. 7,000 cases made. —JS

Beautifully proportioned, rich and complex, with ripe, concentrated plum, currant, black cherry, mocha, toasty oak and spice nuances. Turns smooth and silky on a long, elegant finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2012. 4,800 cases made. —JL

Absolutely delicious, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (mostly), Cabernet Franc and Merlot is brimming with ripe and juicy currant, blackcherry, wild berry, plum and anise flavors that are complex, deep and polished. Finishes long and flavorful. Best from 2002 through 2012. 8,000 cases made. —JL

An explosive and racy Châteauneuf, bursting with roasted game, wild berry, grilled bread, dark chocolate and espresso character. Ripe and sweet-tasting, with enough opulent fruit to balance the firm tannin structure that rises like an impenetrable wall on the spectacular finish. Best from 2005 through 2020. 4,165 cases made. —PM

Black color. Aromas of blackberries, minerals and mint. Very subtle. Full-bodied, with amazing concentration of silky tannins and a finish that goes on and on. Monumental Sammarco. Best ever for me. Best after 2005. 3,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Whitehall Lane Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve +
Notes: Deliciously ripe, rich and deeply flavored, with juicy layers of coffee, herb, currant, sage, chocolate, toffee and spice, with a long, complex, integrated finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 2,850 cases made. —JL

Massive, with wonderful richness, depth and concentration, this Cabernet blend has layers of complex currant, black cherry, plum, vanilla and blackberry and a long, detailed, firmly tannic finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 5,200 cases made. —JL

Distinguished, deep and complex Rhône, offeringlayers of wet earth, mineral and ripe fruit in aseductive and harmonious combination. Superbmidpalate concentration. Full-bodied and intense,with massive but refined tannins. Still, it needsaging. Best from 2003 through 2020. 2,500 cases made. —PM

Wine: Château La Nerthe Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée des Cadettes +
Notes: Seductive and sexy, this world-class red is rich, opulent and ripe, with layers of superb mocha, toast and spice. Loaded with blackberry and cassis, its fabulous balance leads to a long fruit-and-oak finish. Very tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2030. 2,200 cases made. —PM

Superrich and seductive version of this prestigious red, its layers of currant, black cherry, chocolate and ginger turning smooth and polished, with a long, intricate aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2012. 20,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Bryant Family Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: An ultrarich and polished Cabernet, superripe and jammy, with a dense concentration of thick and spicy plum, wild berry, black cherry and currant. Finishes with pretty dashes of oak, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Best from 2003 through 2015. 1,000 cases made. —JL

This Tuscan gem is black in color, with complex aromas of black currants, minerals and wet earth. Full- bodied, with lots of tannins, but very polished. Long, long finish. Super well-made—a great Ornellaia. Best after 2004. 11,415 cases made. —JS

Kaleidoscopic character. This Piedmont red offers deep and rich aromas of ripe plum, meat and dried fruit and is full-bodied, with wonderfully polished tannins and a finish of red fruit and spice that goes on for minutes. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Kistler Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard +
Notes: A seamless wine of classic proportions. Ripe, rich and polished, with tiers of pear, citrus, melon, hazelnut and fig culminating in a long, polished aftertaste. Kudos to Kistler. Drink now through 2006. 1,882 cases made. —JL

Wine: Antinori Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso Tenuta Belvedere +
Notes: A balanced and harmonious young red. Dark ruby color, with loads of grape, berry, mineral and violet aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of blackberry and cherry character, fine tannins and a medium finish. Gorgeous wine. Best after 2005. —JS

The greatest modern vintage of Niepoort. Shows a black color and intense aromas of crushed berries and wet earth, with a slight stemminess. Full-bodied and mouthpuckering, this young bodybuilder of a Port has loads of fruit and powerful tannins. Amazingly long finish. Best after 2009. 4,000 cases made. —JS

Monster Brunello. Very dark in color, withsuperripe aromas of black licorice, dried plum,mint and meat. Full-bodied, with masses of velvetytannins and a long, long finish. Best version ofthis Tuscan red since the legendary 1990Montosoli. Give it time. Best after 2004. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Rich and distinctive, a bit lighter than moststraight Aussie Shirazes but dripping withflavors, corralling a wild range of meatyblackberry, red cherry, black cherry and pepperflavors into a smooth wine of enormous characterand depth. Appealing already. Best after 2002. 4,500 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Chapelle +
Notes: What a great wine. Full-bodied, with crushed berry, smoke and grilled aromas, all presented quite subtly. Stands out for its natural, down-to-earth taste of clean, pure, shining fruit. A pleasure to drink. Tempting now. Best from 2003 through 2015. 7,765 cases made. —PM

Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard Tapestry Reserve Napa Valley +
Notes: Big, bold, rich and polished, this is an immense and deeply concentrated Cabernet blend laden with ripe plum, currant, anise, green olive and cedar notes and finishing with gripping tannins. Best from 2002 through 2012. 27,000 cases made. —JL

Super. I love the nose of this young Port, which shows raisin, spice and a little stemminess. Full-bodied, medium-sweet, with loads of ripe tannins and a long, long finish. Really racy and exciting. Even better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2006. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Already tight as a drum, yet glorious aromas of flowers, berries and cherries come forth with air. The wine is full-bodied and very tannic, but has loads of fruit and fresh acidity. Don't touch this monster yet. Best after 2006. 2,380 cases made. —JS

Wine: St. Clement Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Polished and stylish, with beautiful violet, blackberry, mocha and Asian spice flavors. Ripe, round tannins are seamlessly integrated, finishing with focused intensity. Drink now through 2008. 7,100 cases made. —JL

Weaves together a complex array of rich black cherry, ripe plum, wild berry and floral notes, all sharply focused, finishing with firm tannins and wonderful length. Best from 2002 through 2010. 3,400 cases made. —JL

Lovely. Shows typical Châteauneuf character, withroasted, toasted and grilled notes in a supplepackage. Full of ripe plum and sweet but firmtannins, it's full-bodied and deeply satisfying,retaining its textbook personality through thelingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,330 cases made. —PM

Wine: Archery Summit Pinot Noir Oregon Premier Cuvée +
Notes: Ripe, round and distinctive, with juicy, spicy, floral notes around currant and plum flavors that linger long. This Pinot has all its elements packed in tightly and harmoniously. Very classy. Drink now through 2010. 2,809 cases made. —HS

Distinctive, very monolithic, clean, pure and crisp, with fresh fruit zipping along the palate. Turning a bit tough and tannic, it holds back a lot now, delivering little seduction, hiding well its leather, game, truffle and black fruit character, yet it's undeniably balanced. Made to age. Best from 2010 through 2030. 15,000 cases made. —PM

Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Georges de Latour Private Reserve +
Notes: An extraordinary wine, dense, rich and earthy, with broad, plush tannins and tiers of complex currant, earth, cedar, black cherry, mineral and anise flavors. Keeps a tight focus on the long, rich, detailed aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2010. 17,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Gustave Lorentz Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Altenberg de Bergheim +
Notes: Terrific. Beautiful aromas of flowers, pine forests, peaches and citrus. Rich, creamy and just off-dry midpalate, with firm underlying structure, yet the finish is dry. Still needs time. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made. —BS

A monster Italian red. Aromas of coffee, roastedmeat and ripe berries precede a full-bodied winewith mouthpuckering tannins and an enormousconcentration of fruit. What it lacks in eleganceand sophistication it gives in concentration andpower. Best after 2003. 8,750 cases made. —JS

Smooth, polished and positively glowing with fruit and spice flavors, bursting across the palate with gorgeous blackberry, black cherry, anise and cinnamon flavors, swirling in some sweet vanilla and pepper on the long finish. Best from 2002 through 2020. 12,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Caymus Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Special Selection +
Notes: This banner year's Special Selection is smooth, rich and concentrated, with layers of currant, mocha, black cherry and wild berry, fairly gushing at midpalate. The finish is long, rich, and intricate. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made. —JL

A wonderful, masterful wine. Both firm and opulent, it displays a nice dig into the Rhône terroir as it brings out wet earth, mineral and an interesting, chewy tannin structure. A high-voltage drinking experience, with lots of fruit, spice and mocha. Best from 2003 through 2020. 16,665 cases made. —PM

Gorgeous. Savage, exploding with cassis and dried and fresh herb aromas, it produces a most sensual, soft midpalate mouthfeel. Full-bodied, it's subtle despite its rich concentration. Best from 2003 through 2015. 4,000 cases made. —PM

Wine: Domaine du Vieux Télégraphe Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Crau +
Notes: Reserved aromatically, but the wonderful balance is evident as this young Rhône red reveals its mineral, wet earth, delicate plum, mocha, coffee and blackberry character and subtle, ripe tannins. The wet earth and mineral really shine through on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 16,665 cases made. —PM

A beautiful, terroir-driven wine. Thick and elegant, with mineral, wet earth, plum and blackberry. Silky midpalate, but tannic and uncompromising on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2004 through 2015. 3,665 cases made. —PM

A massive wine, majestic in its proportions,combining power and grace in equal measure. Flavors of plum, blackberry, chocolate and pepper, with hints of cedar, licorice and mint, swirl through the exotic finish. Tannins swarm but don't overwhelm the finish, which echoes all day and night. Best from 2004 through 2020. 9,800 cases made. —HS

Impressive. Espresso-style, deeply concentrated Merlot, boasting a core of rich currant, coffee, black cherry and anise. Firms up on the finish, where a touch of bay leaf adds complexity to the flavor profile. Drink now through 2006. 4,137 cases made. —JL

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard +
Notes: Rich, ripe and focused, this Washington Cabernet shows layers of currant, plum and vanilla flavors, with hints of pepper and bay leaf sneaking in on the long, supple finish. Fine-grained tannins. Best from 2001 through 2008. 5,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Talbott Chardonnay Monterey Sleepy Hollow Vineyard +
Notes: Deep, ripe, rich and concentrated, this outstanding California Chardonnay delivers layers of fig, pear, apple and melon and gains nice oaky touches of hazelnut and cedar before finishing with a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made. —JL

Wine: Pasanau Germans Priorat Finca La Planeta +
Notes: Intense. First, ripe fruit coats the palate, then darker flavors of coffee, anise and minerals emerge and linger. Firm tannins and high alcohol build an impressive structure. A big wine that needs time to unwind. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made. —TM

Sturdy, rich and detailed, with complex, earthy currant, sage, mineral, tobacco and anise flavors that fan out and saturate the palate. Finishes with muscular tannins. Best Mondavi Oakville yet. Best from 2002 through 2012. —JL

Big and powerful Tuscan red. Quite dark in color, with an intense blackberry, raspberry and floral character. Full-bodied, with very chewy tannins. Very tight now. Best after 2005. 1,077 cases made. —JS

Sweet-tasting and ripe, sophisticated in its smooth, round and silky mouthfeel, delivering loads of fruit and wet earth. An attractive version of this Rhône red. Drink now through 2015. 7,500 cases made. —PM

Wine: Bodegas Muga Rioja Torre Muga Reserva +
Notes: Beautifully aromatic, with notes of cassis,lilacs, coffee and spices, this sinuous red ispolished and elegant, yet dense with fruit, oakand earthy flavors that linger and expand on thelong finish. An extraordinary marriage of typicityand sophistication. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Dalla Valle Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Tremendous flavor, dark, ripe, rich and packed with black cherry, currant, anise, cedar and spice. Finishes with firm but deliciously well-integrated tannins. Best from 2003 through 2012. 2,400 cases made. —JL

This wine is opulent, rich and creamy, with a core of nectarine, fig, citrus, pineapple and spice supported by firm, lively acidity, finishing long and full. Lovely Chardonnay from a growing California appellation. Drink now through 2005. 9,000 cases made. —JL

Dark and intense, with a solid, plush core of ripe, rich currant, black cherry, blackberry and light cedar notes. Jam-packed with flavors, it's an immense wine but beautifully balanced. Best from 2002 through 2012. 3,742 cases made. —JL

Wine: Columbia Crest Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Estate Series +
Notes: Round and cedary, this Washington red deliversdepth, length and distinctive flavor. Ripe, plushand generous with its exotic, seductive aromas andflavors, layering rich plum, currant and clove ona bed of fine-grained tannins. Great price/scoreratio. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Landmark Chardonnay Sonoma-Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Overlook +
Notes: Quite rich and concentrated, with a core of fig, pear, nectarine and spicy oak. Holds its focus, turning elegant and supple. Drink now through 2004. 18,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: M. Chapoutier Hermitage Monier de la Sizeranne +
Notes: Fabulous. This serious Hermitage digs deep inhillside Rhône soil, with mineral, wet earth andgrilled character. Intense and complex, showing atoasted, smoky essence and loads of blackberryflavors. Refined tannins turn firm and givestructure to the long finish. Best from 2005 through 2020. 1,227 cases made. —PM

Great structure, deliciously rich and complex, deep and fragrant, with layers of concentrated black cherry, plum, currant and wild berry, picking up pretty spice and floral notes and finishing with a long, lingering finish. Tempting now. Best from 2002 through 2016. 2,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Castello Banfi Cabernet Sauvignon Sant'Antimo Tavernelle +
Notes: This outstanding Cabernet Sauvignon from Tuscanyhas interesting aromas of ripe fruit and meat,with hints of dried herbs. It's full-bodied andvery concentrated, with plenty of velvety tanninsand a long finish. Give it some time in thebottle. Best after 2001. 7,500 cases made. —JS

Has a subtle, refined, minerally, midpalate sweetness that coats the taste buds. Ends with lovely, light-winged balance and black cherry, blackberry and plum flavors. Best from 2003 through 2015. 5,000 cases made. —PM

Wine: Casanova di Neri Brunello di Montalcino Tenuta Nuova +
Notes: This is a blockbuster Brunello--the real thing. Tastes very ripe and earthy, with lots of wonderful fruit and wet leaf character. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,945 cases made. —JS

Wine: Fontodi Colli della Toscana Centrale Flaccianello +
Notes: This builds and builds and builds on the palate. Gorgeous aromas of ripe berries, meat and spices. Full-bodied, with polished, well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Give it time. Best after 2005. 5,000 cases made. —JS

A superrich and jammy Aussie red sporting a wonderful array of black cherry, wild berry, seductive toasty oak and spice nuances. The texture is silky-smooth, the finish a mile-long. Drink now through 2008. 1,800 cases made. —JL

Wine: Stags' Leap Winery Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Beautifully polished, ripe and intricate Cabernet from an awesome vintage, with layers of rich currant, plum, mocha, sage and floral notes, finishing long and firm, with a complex aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2012. 19,500 cases made. —JL

Super Barbaresco. Intense aromas of ripe plums, violets and berries lead to a full-bodied palate with chewy tannins. Long finish tastes of superripe fruit. Lovely and powerful wine. Best after 2005. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Bodegas LAN Rioja Viña Lanciano Reserva +
Notes: Elegant. This polished Spanish red is bursting with cherry, berry, spice and vanilla flavors that float over fine-grained tannins and linger, fresh and clean, on the long finish. A beautiful example of the traditional style. Drink now through 2006. 13,600 cases made. —TM

Wine: Domaine du Pégaü Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée Réservée +
Notes: Superopulent. Full-bodied and thick, with rich, ripe fruit flavors that taste sweet midpalate. Wonderful, supple, velvety finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2015. 6,250 cases made. —PM

Wine: Raymond Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve +
Notes: A nice round red, with ripe flavors of black currant, cotton candy, spice and lavish toasty oak. Solid tannins integrate harmoniously with coffee flavors on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2009. 30,000 cases made. —JL

An explosive, grand Syrah. Complex and deep,layered with twists and turns that spin your tastebuds around merrily. Imagine leather, wet earth,grilled meat, a garden in bloom and blackberrynotes--all of this comes together in thisultrasupple, round, generous red. Best from 2002 through 2010. 2,080 cases made. —PM

Seamless. This red is a beautiful combination of ripe fruit, powerful structure and polished texture. Lush flavors of blackberries and plums are supported by firm, ripe tannins and give way to coffee and mineral notes on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made. —TM

Wine: Columbia Crest Chardonnay Columbia Valley Estate Series +
Notes: A complex, creamy Washington white, rich, long and generous, dripping with pear, honey, nutmeg and clove, the flavors lingering enticingly. Delicious already. Drink now through 2003. 30,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Rosemount Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot McLaren Vale Traditional +
Notes: Dark, ripe and complex, this red blend reveals its depth with layers of ripe plum, blackberry, coffee and earth. Finishes with a wide range of tasty herb flavors and rich, full tannins. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Caves des Papes Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Closiers +
Notes: Seductive because of the rich fruit and suppletannins, but also the fresh, clean and crispcharacter that cleanses the palate and gives thisfull-bodied, ripe red a sense of elegance andvibrancy. Has raisiny and plummy aromas, withroasted game, grilled lamb chops and cassisjam. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made. —PM

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle-Dr. Loosen Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica +
Notes: Offers a bouquet of wonderful flavors, pouring outits pear, apricot, mineral and honey notes.Off-dry but balanced, with enough of a steelybackbone to make the flavors sing. A collaborativeeffort of Chateau Ste. Michelle and Mosel's Dr.Loosen. Wonderful now. Best from 2002 through 2009. 2,600 cases made. —HS

Rich and spicy, with a definite honey note along with pear and citrus aromas and flavors, balanced to let the flavors linger nicely, echoing honey and ripe pear. Drink now through 2005. 16,109 cases imported. —HS
Ripe and fleshy, with blackberry, chocolate and toffee flavors supported by round tannins that linger on an intense finish. Drink now through 2005. 14,382 cases made. —JL

Wine: Selaks Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premium Selection +
Notes: Crisp and fragrant, this Kiwi white delivers a riot of floral and tropical fruit flavors, favoring passion fruit, lime and spicy rose petal notes. Delicious, and affordable, too. Drink now. 8,000 cases made. —HS

Entrancing for its pure, focused fruit character, this reputable red centers on blueberry, blackberry and currant that echo beautifully on the long, gorgeous finish. Harmonious and inviting already, it should only gain with cellaring. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases imported. —HS

Grows on you. Rich and earthy, with complex herb, currant, sage and cedary oak notes, all folding together nicely and finishing in a concentrated aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2010. 15,400 cases made. —JL

This red makes a statement. Fresh, bold and extravagantly oaked, exuding vanilla, coffee and toast elements, backed by a core of rich, concentrated plum and black currant. Lovely acidity keeps it all lively, and the long finish bodes well for the future. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Best from 2001 through 2008. 3,000 cases made. —BS

Smooth and round, layering its generous pear and nectarine flavors with spicy, floral overtones. The fruit flavors remain lively and balanced throughout, echo beautifully on the rich finish. Drink now through 2009. 10,000 cases imported. —HS

Blockbuster style of red Burgundy. Inky-black in color, full in body, packed with flavors, but also delivering great finesse with its silky tannins. Bold but focused blackberry, wild raspberry, smoke, petrol, and tar complexity. A winner, with its silky texture that endures through a long, balanced finish. Best from 2003 through 2015. 405 cases made. —PM

Wine: Freemark Abbey Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Intense, with mineral, vanilla, currant and mushroom notes, offering excellent length, with sturdy tannins and chocolate richness on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 9,955 cases made. —JL

Wine: Château du Trignon Côtes du Rhône-Villages Sablet +
Notes: Seductive red for a Valentine's date. A bit earthy--but what amazing texture and ripeness in the midpalate. It just massages the taste buds,offering a hedonistic tasting experience that makes you dream. Mineral from the wet earth, blackberry and massive, sweet tannins. Very terroir-driven. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made. —PM

This Tuscan red is big and plummy, full-bodied and tannic, with loads of vanilla and coconut, lots of pepper and berry character, too. Long, slightly hard finish. Needs time to mellow. Best after 2003. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Dark purple in color, with wonderful violet, berry and cherry aromas. Full-bodied, medium-sweet, with a solid core of fruit and tannins. Long finish. Subtle. Best Sandeman since the 1960s. Best after 2008. 25,200 cases made. —JS

Wine: Robert Eymael (Mönchhof) Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten +
Notes: A powerful spätlese, this offers an amazing silkiness, harmony and bracing framework, with peach, lime and slate persisting to a long aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2006. 750 cases made. —BS

Wine: Barossa Valley Estate Shiraz Barossa Valley Ebenezer +
Notes: Firm in texture, with juicy plum, blackberry and rose petal flavors, the fruit echoing enticingly amid the fine-grained tannins on the finish. Appealing already, but it's destined for a long life. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made. —HS

Wine: Feudi di San Gregorio Fiano di Avellino +
Notes: An impressive Italian white with layers of tropical fruit and citrus character. It's full-bodied, with wonderful concentration, good acidity and a long, long flavorful finish. Drink now through 2004. 21,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Antinori Chianti Classico Badia a Passignano Riserva +
Notes: Impressive Chianti Classico riserva. Aromas of currants, blackberries and toasted oats. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Still needs time to open. Best after 2001. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Fattoria Le Pupille Morellino di Scansano Riserva +
Notes: This Tuscan red is gorgeous. Emitting beautiful aromas of blackberry, wet earth and toasted oak, it's full-bodied and very polished, with fine tannins and a fresh, delicious finish. Needs time. Best after 2000. 2,590 cases made. —JS

Wine: Columbia Crest Merlot Columbia Valley Estate Vineyards +
Notes: Beautifully proportioned to balance the fruit and oak, generous without being weighty, this Washington red serves up a lush mouthful of ripe berry and spice flavors, dripping with chocolate and sage notes on the polished finish. Drink now through 2007. 20,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: St. Francis Merlot Sonoma Valley Reserve +
Notes: Superripe California Merlot, rich and oaky, in an opulent style delivering layers of currant, black cherry, coconut, cedar and spice, and finishing with a long and intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 7,500 cases made. —JL

A wonderful value that is complex, ripe, bold and rich, layered with earth, pear, toast, fig and smoky oak flavors. It's smooth in texture, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 11,159 cases made. —JL

Wine: Freie Weingärtner Wachau Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer Singerriedel +
Notes: Multidimensional. Intense aromas of licorice and spice combine with a broad structure and thick texture that feels more like that of a red wine. Closed now, so be patient. Best from 2001 through 2006. 625 cases made. —BS

Wine: Joh. Jos. Prüm Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr +
Notes: A textbook auslese, literally bursting with apricot, nectarine, lime and mineral. Clean and beautifully balanced, with the sweetness playing off the vivid acidity and silky texture. Already delicious, this should age gracefully. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made. —BS

Fat and flavorful, This is a richly textured red wine that unfolds its ripe black cherry, blackberry and anise flavors like a thick quilt. Soft, warm and generous, with a sweet, supple finish. Drink now through 2008. 15,700 cases imported. —HS

A wonderfully crafted red, with complex aromas of ripe fruit, Indian spice and tea. Full-bodied, with extremely polished tannins and a finish that goes on for minutes. Drink now through 2006. 4,000 cases made. —JS

Vibrant. Clean and lively, with lovely midpalate concentration, this medium- to full-bodied white Burgundy is straight as an arrow. Fabulous balance of subtle toasted oak and ripe fruit. An ager. Best from 2002 through 2008. 4,830 cases made. —PM

Wine: Gallo of Sonoma Chardonnay Russian River Valley Laguna Ranch Vineyard +
Notes: Restrained on the nose, this tightly wound Chardonnay turns more complex and sophisticated on the palate, with a core of pear and nectarine flavors and a rich, buttery aftertaste that's long and focused. Drink now through 2006 . 7,400 cases made. —JL

Here's an Italian white that tastes like a villageMeursault from Lafon; very impressive. Golden incolor, with very ripe pineapple and apricot aromasplus hints of vanilla and dough. Full in body,with lots of unctuous fruit and a long, longfinish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made. —JS
Smooth and generous, with coffee-scented blackberry and spice flavors that mix nicely on the finish and linger surprisingly gently for such a solid wine. Drink now through 2008. 3,600 cases made. —HS

Wine: Pol Roger Brut Champagne Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill +
Notes: Power and intensity in a glass. Bold and full of bread dough and apple, with a marmalade note, married to a big, firm structure, it still seems youthful. A brilliant Champagne that should develop beautifully. Best from 2001 through 2010. 6,250 cases made. —BS

Wine: Chimney Rock Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Rich and layered, with ripe blackberry, cherry and mocha flavors that finish with soft tannins framing mellow herbal and coffee notes. Drink now through 2008. 12,017 cases made. —JL

Bright, jazzy and yummy, with passion fruit, citrus and pear aromas and flavors on a racy frame, this New Zealand white is quite impressive for the price. Lean, lithe and exciting to sip now. Drink now. 12,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Muré Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Vorbourg Clos St.-Landelin +
Notes: A hint of residual sugar provides opulence, but also hides the searing acidity in this powerful, monolithic white. Apple, honey and marmalade accents hold court, ending with a satisfying aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2005. 1,480 cases made. —BS

A cool and sleek Tuscan red, with tarragon and fresh sage aromas, blackberry and cherry undertones. Full-bodied, with a wonderfully silky palate of fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Very sophisticated and reserved. Best after 2004. 13,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: Avignonesi Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Grandi Annate Riserva +
Notes: Emits phenomenal aromas of crushed berries, roses, lilacs and currants. Full-bodied, with an incredible backbone of ultrafine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Not big and thick, but powerful and subtle. A very special wine indeed; the greatest Vino Nobile ever made. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 2,600 cases made. —JS

Subtle, complex and refined, with aromas of cherry, licorice, mineral, berry and other sweet, ripe fruit. Full-bodied and compacted, with masses of fine, silky tannins. Long, long finish. Best after 2010. 8,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: E. Guigal Côte-Rôtie Brune et Blonde +
Notes: Caresses the palate. Elegant, with mineral, red and black fruit and supple tannins. Seductive balance on the fresh finish, where the firm tannins make a surprise appearance that suggests a bit of cellar time is needed to bring out the best of this red. Best from 2003 through 2010. 31,665 cases made. —PM

Extraordinarily rich, deep, complex and concentrated, yet remarkably elegant and graceful, this deft red blend reveals layers of exotic spice, black cherry, currant, coffee, tobacco and cedary notes ending in a long, complex aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,500 cases made. —JL

Wine: Antinori Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso +
Notes: Wonderful balance here. Violet and berry aromas, with intense tarragon and currant character. Full-bodied and gorgeous, with wonderful finesse and subtlety. Very long. Best after 2005. 9,500 cases made. —JS

Gorgeous. Black in color, supple in texture, rich and thick, with lots of pure black- and red-fruit aromas jumping out of the glass. This Rhône red is full-bodied, with distinctive wild herbs, pine forest, garrigue-like aromas that go on and on. Fabulously long finish. Drink now through 2012. 6,500 cases made. —PM

Wonderful aromas of ripe fruit, Indian spices and mineral. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a plush structure that caresses every inch of your palate. Really fine and fabulous. Much better than from barrel. Best ever from this estate. Best after 2010. 4,580 cases made. —JS

Captivating aromas of wild raspberry, cherry, mineral and grilled meat mark this full-bodied wine, along with huge,silky tannins and an extra-long, caressing finish. Envelops the palate like a perfectly tailored silk shirt. Incredible class, with everything in wonderful proportions. The greatest L'Evangile ever made. Best after 2010. 3,000 cases made. —JS

Unbelievable quality. Made in serious quantity. Glorious aromas of crushed flowers, prunes, cedar and cigars. Full-bodied, thick and tannic, yet ripe and round, with a sleek, caressing finish. A classic Barolo that is well-priced. Best after 2005. 6,200 cases made. —JS

This young Bordeaux shows intense aromas of wet earth, stone and berries. It's full-bodied, with super well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Very well made indeed, and much better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2008. 9,165 cases made. —JS

Wine: Landmark Chardonnay Sonoma-Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Overlook +
Notes: Smooth, rich and creamy on the palate, this Chardonnay offers a charming array of spice, pear, apple, tangerine, pineapple, fig and guava flavors, staying tightly focused, turning elegant and sophisticated. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle Chardonnay Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard +
Notes: Vibrant and juicy Chardonnay, beautifully focused to show off its creamy pear, tangy citrus and generous pineapple aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the impeccably balanced finish. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made. —HS

Rich and ripe, a lovely and seductive Rhône red. Packed with wild herb, plum and blackberry complexity, it caresses the palate with its rich fruit and silky tannins. Full-bodied, with mineral, slight smoke, leather and game character on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,165 cases made. —PM

Black ruby in color, intense aromas of blackberries, licorice, red berries and green tobacco, this is a full-bodied red with loads of silky tannins and a long, long aftertaste of tobacco, sage and berry. A huge core of fruit in this wine. Needs time. An Italian interpretation of great Bordeaux from bygone days. Best after 2006. 7,450 cases made. —JS

Lovely and mineral-tasting, with black fruit galore. Full-bodied and fleshy, ripe and balanced, with sweet tannins turning chewy on the long, smooth finish. Drink now through 2010. 6,250 cases made. —PM

A massive wine, with cascades of potent plum, cherry and blackberry fruit swirling around wafts of black pepper, bay leaf and exotic spice, which last and last on the finish, hinting at smoky, meaty notes. It's all packed in tightly, suggesting this should evolve spectacularly with age. Best after 2005. 10,228 cases made. —HS

A superb Sperss, with refined aromas of minerals, flowers, berries and just a hint of mint. Full-bodied and powerful, with chewy tannins and a long berry, cherry and mineral aftertaste. Impressive structure. Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made. —JS
Aromas of mineral, berry, flowers and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long and fruity finish. I love this. Outstanding for this estate. Best after 2008. 3,000 cases made. —JS

A tight and muscular young wine. Very floral on the nose, with gorgeous berry and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, fresh and fruity finish. Very fine and harmonious. Best after 2008. 6,500 cases made. —JS

A blockbuster. Black in color, with extremely grapey, toasted oak and dark chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Best Clos de L'Oratoire ever. Best after 2010. 4,000 cases made. —JS

A big, rich, dense and distinctive California red that adds some earthy, leathery dimensions to its appealing core of currant and plummy, minerally Cabernet fruit flavors. Tightens on the finish, with mouthcoating tannins. Best from 2003 through 2012. 3,486 cases made. —JL

Wine: Chateau Reynella Syrah McLaren Vale Basket Pressed +
Notes: Crisp and juicy Shiraz, rich with fruit, bursting with flavor, offering a cascade of bright berry, guava, plum and anise flavors, echoing with a distinctive black pepper note on the spicy finish. Fine-grained tannins don't get in the way. Drink now through 2012. 8,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Krug Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil +
Notes: A tightly wound thoroughbred, with complex nut and biscuit notes playing off a floral freshness. Driving it all is a racy acidity matched by a seamless elegance and innate power that lingers through the persistent ginger-tinged finish. Will age beautifully. Drink now through 2008. 1,200 cases made. —BS

Wine: Domaine Brusset Gigondas Le Grand Montmirail +
Notes: Fantastic. Dark and deep, with lots of black fruit, this is as silky a red as you can imagine—all cream and smoothness and seduction. Full-bodied, it kicks in with a touch of fresh fruit character on the long, juicy finish. Massive, sweet tannins lurk in the background, so it should age. Drink now through 2010. 3,750 cases made. —PM

Wine: Château St.-Martin de la Garrigue Coteaux du Languedoc Bronzinelle +
Notes: A powerhouse red from the south of France. Rich and complex, with vivid and well-defined flavors of dark plum, meat and spice. Deeply colored with a meaty aroma, this has the stuffing to age. Peppery and brickish notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases imported. —KM

Wine: Château La Grave à Pomerol Pomerol +
Notes: Like a whirlpool of fruit that draws you to the center. Full-bodied, with wonderfully silky tannins and a finish that lasts for minutes. Drink now. 3,300 cases made. —JS

A big, new-wave wine. Extremely grapey, with toasted oak, grilled and berry aromas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long finish. A crowd pleaser. Monbousquet is serious. Best after 2008. 7,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Freie Weingärtner Wachau Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Loibenberg +
Notes: Brilliant effort. Amply proportioned and spicy, this '99 Riesling combines fascinating smoke, quince and peach flavors with a vibrant structure that drives the flavors. Explodes on the finish with a potpourri of mineral and spice. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made. —BS

A wine bursting with berry and green tobacco character, plus lots of currant, raisin and spice aromas. Full-bodied, with full, velvety tannins and a long aftertaste of tobacco and earth. Mouthpuckering. Best DC in years. Best after 2006. 7,000 cases made. —JS

A full-blown Chardonnay, opulent, lush and creamy, displaying juicy fig, tangerine, pear, pineapple and melon flavors that are neatly layered and persist for a long finish, where pretty notes of toasty oak fold in. Delicious. Drink now through 2004. 13,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Fattoria del Cerro Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva +
Notes: Ripe and powerful aromas of berries and smoke, with hints of raisins. Full-bodied and massive in the mouth, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A blockbuster riserva. Best after 2004. 7,100 cases made. —JS

A triumph. Masses of ripe apple, toasted oak, with dried pineapple, mango and apricot aromas. Full-bodied, with super flavors, yet it remains fresh and lively on the palate. The "full monty" for Chardonnay. Drink now through 2004. 6,665 cases made. —JS
California in St.-Emilion. Black color, with spice, coffee and tobacco aromas. Full-bodied and thick, with loads of fruit and velvety tannins. A blockbuster. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made. —JS

This Veneto red is glorious and rich, yet sophisticated. Dark ruby color, it emits aromas of raisins and berries, and hints of cocoa and spice. It's full-bodied, with chewy yet velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2001. 11,000 cases made. —JS

Lovely, subtle yet complex aromas of currants, sage and green olives lead to a full-bodied red with a solid core of fruit and well-integrated tannins. Still very reserved on the finish, but those who are patient should be rewarded. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2005. 13,000 cases made. —JS

Lovely. This youthful red is both elegant and concentrated, with spice, licorice and gamy notes accenting a core of ripe cherry. It's supple, yet firm enough for food. Drink now through 2010. 20,000 cases made. —TM
Fantastic aromas of berry, chocolate and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long finish. Very well done. A château on the rise. Best after 2006. 9,580 cases made. —JS

Wine: Georges Duboeuf Moulin-à-Vent Aged in Oak +
Notes: Raspberry confiture aroma draws you in, then a blast of black cherry and cassis hits the palate, followed by sweet smoke, vanilla and cinnamon notes. Flavors drip off the back end, but stay elegant and refreshing all the way through. Drink now through 2002. 12,000 cases made. —JM

This rich, complex red drips with juicy blackberry, cherry and exotic spice flavors, weaving in hints of game and pepper as everything lingers on the long finish. Tannins are soft, making the wine seductive. Drink now through 2010. 15,000 cases made. —HS

Amazing. This is a beautiful Chablis, tightly structured and very refined, expanding its mineral base to encompass some vanilla, ripe fruit, honey and slightly spicy oak. Medium-bodied and very long on the finish, it just keeps riding into the sunset. Best from 2003 through 2010. 16,000 cases made. —PM

Sharply focused, rich and complex, this is an impressive Chardonnay, with pretty pear, fig, melon and apricot flavors. Turns spicy, with anise and cedar, and finishes with a long and lively aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 13,928 cases made. —JL

Wine: Beringer Chardonnay Napa Valley Private Reserve +
Notes: The smoky, toasty, figgy, buttery aromas of this enticing white lead to similar rich flavors running deep and persistent, picking up notes of pear, apricot, citrus and melon. Finish zooms on and on. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Bodegas LAN Rioja Viña Lanciano Reserva +
Notes: Powerful and still youthful, this dark and muscular red from Spain has firm, ripe tannins supporting ripe, fresh flavors of black cherry, cassis, vanilla and licorice. A fine example of the international style. Drink now through 2010. 14,000 cases made. —TM

A dazzling red, dark, rich and exuberant, this wine reveals layers of peppery plum, black cherry and blueberry fruit that turn lush, with smooth tannins. Great example of its type. Drink now through 2008. 8,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Columbia Crest Chardonnay Columbia Valley Grand Estates +
Notes: Rich and vibrant, beautifully focused to show off its plush honey, spice and smoke-accented pear and apricot flavors. Finish is seductively polished and as smooth as a Jean Arp sculpture. Drink now through 2005. 120,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Belle Père & Fils Crozes-Hermitage Les Pierrelles +
Notes: Ultrathick and concentrated Crozes; the liquid hangs on to the inside of the glass as you swirl it. The wine has mineral, iron, wet earth and ripe, clean fruit character that seduces, thanks to the sweetness of the whole package. Full-bodied, tough and long, this needs time in the cellar to smooth out. Best from 2005 through 2012. 5,415 cases made. —PM

Wine: Domaine de la Vieille Julienne Châteauneuf-du-Pape +
Notes: Supple, balanced and subtle. Traditional Châteauneuf that emphasizes the sweet, ripe fruit, mineral character of the land, and roasted, plummy notes. Medium- to full-bodied, it's delicious from start to finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made. —PM

Wine: St. Supéry Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: A rich, complex and concentrated mouthful, delivering ripe plum, black cherry, blackberry and mineral flavors and finishing with a firm core of tannins, this '97 is a tremendous value as both a ready to drink and an ageable Cabernet. Best from 2002 through 2009. 29,317 cases made. —JL

Delicious and stylish young red, balancing fresh, focused and ripe fruit, clean and pure, with mineral, spice, mocha and coffee notes. Dark-colored and medium-bodied, its tannins are sweet, and there's pure fruit on the lively finish. Drink now through 2007. 40,000 cases made. —PM

Subtle aromas of mineral, berry, cherry and licorice. Full-bodied, with wonderfully polished tannins and a long, long finish. Amazing quality for this estate. One of the great buys of the vintage. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Bright and lively, beautifully proportioned New Zealand white, juicy with cascades of melon, apple and passion fruit flavors that echo on the finish against a note of bracing acidity. Drink now. 8,900 cases made. —HS

Wine: Wolf Blass Riesling South Australia Gold Label +
Notes: Wonderfully aromatic Riesling, its glorious noseful of apricot and floral notes segueing into off-dry flavors that center around lime and apple, with mineral and peppery-floral overtones. Tempting now, but should develop more depth and texture with age. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,000 cases made. —HS

Maintains a sense of elegance and finesse, even with its rich, creamy core of earth, pear, fig, citrus, hazelnut and nectarine flavors. Long and complex on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,029 cases made. —JL

Fabulous. Deep and rich, very sweet and ripe, a complex wine, with roasted game, plum, blackberry, smoke, leather and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with a long-lasting finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,750 cases made. —PM

White Châteauneuf with beautiful clean, fresh, juicy, ripe fruit. Mingles honey, fresh figs, apricot and loads of other stuff. It's medium- to full-bodied, long and amazingly attractive. Drink now through 2010. 5,665 cases made. —PM

Wine: Beaux Frères Pinot Noir Yamhill County The Beaux Frères Vineyard +
Notes: Bright, supple and open-textured, offering disarmingly pure currant and blackberry flavors that linger elegantly on the extra-long finish. Not a blockbuster; it's just yummy and refined. Tannins aren't intrusive, making it tempting to drink already. Drink now through 2009. 3,100 cases made. —HS

A lovely, juicy wine, with very soft and polished tannins, ripe and smoky fruit and a long and beautiful finish. This is gorgeous. The best Terrabianca in years. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2003. 7,915 cases made. —JS

Beautiful. Subtle, supple and elegant, this medium-bodied, ripe Gigondas also delivers lovely plum, mineral, roasted game and other flavors. Exciting, long finish, layered with fat tannins. Drink now through 2010. 4,580 cases made. —PM

Wine: Fattoria di Felsina Chianti Classico Berardenga +
Notes: Lots of dried cherry and crushed black fruit, with polished leather and mineral notes. Medium-bodied, with good acidity on the palate, well-integrated tannins and a well-balanced and fresh finish. Give it a little time in bottle. Best from 2002 through 2005. 14,165 cases made. —JS

A big, Porty, raisiny wine. Very ripe plum and hints of mineral and spice on the nose. Full-bodied, thick and rich, with big, silky tannins. Slightly hot finish. Rather rustic but impressive. Best after 2006. 6,665 cases made. —JS

Very tightly wound at this stage, here's a racy, intense Riesling full of finely etched lime, rhubarb and slate flavors. Be patient, it has all the elements. Best from 2002 through 2008. 4,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: Franciscan Oakville Estate Magnificat Napa Valley +
Notes: Appealing from start to finish. It's smooth and seductive, with pretty toasty oak, spice, currant and black cherry flavors. Mocha, raspberry and cinnamon come in on the finish, along with plush tannins. Great length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 11,500 cases made. —JL

Rich flavors of dark berry and cherry are balanced against a wiry backbone of fine tannins and acidity in this outstanding Shiraz, gaining momentum on the finish. Impressive for its intensity and elegance. Drink now through 2010. 82,489 cases made. —HS

Wine: Domaine de Beaurenard Côtes du Rhône-Villages Rasteau +
Notes: Traditional-style red that's worth hunting down. Digs the earth. Medium-bodied, it kicks up mineral and terroir, while also delivering a mouthful of beautifully ripe, black fruit and lots of firm tannins. Honest wine, without fancy oak, that will improve and soften with age. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made. —PM

A ripe, rich, complex and concentrated California Chardonnay, with layers of ripe pear, fig, citrus and nectarine. Turns creamy and buttery in texture, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 24,310 cases made. —JL

Well done. Aromas of black truffles and ripe fruit introducing a full-bodied wine with lots of fruit and velvety tannins. A mouthful. Amazing for the vintage in the Médoc. Best after 2006. 18,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle-Dr. Loosen Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica +
Notes: Zingy, juicy and flavorful. A beautifully packaged cascade of apple, pineapple, apricot and mineral flavors that just don't quit, echoing on the lively finish. It's off-dry, but with a steely backbone and tremendous intensity. Graceful finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Leonildo Pieropan Soave Classico Superiore La Rocca +
Notes: Hard to believe it's a Soave. Super, with wonderful late-harvest aromas of honey, light butterscotch and straw, this wine is full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and a long, long creamy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now. 3,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: Trimbach Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Émile +
Notes: Ultraseductive, this Riesling offers suave notes of smoke, quince, peach and stone allied to a steely structure. Beautifully integrated, its velvet fabric buffers the intensity of the fruit and acidity. Great finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases made. —BS

Lots of shirt-collar-grabbing verve in this serious South African Sauvignon, a vibrant mix of lime, cut grass, sweet pea and chalk, with good, medium-weight texture and a long, juicy finish. Drink now through 2003. 11,000 cases made. —JM
Supple in texture and lively in flavor, this elegant New Zealand Sauvignon shows minty lime, apple and passion fruit flavors that linger through the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made. —HS

This stylish white has more pizzazz than most. Crisp in texture, ripe in flavor, with passion fruit and pear flavors up front, picking up hints of mint, celery and grapefruit as the finish lingers and lingers. Drink now. 40,000 cases made. —HS

A poor man's Barolo, with mocha, smoky tea and dried fruit on the nose, and superripe, thick and rich fruit, verging on raisins. Full-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a juicy, pruny finish. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 17,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Shafer Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch +
Notes: Sleek, rich and elegant, this Chardonnay offers a pretty array of fig, pear, anise, nectarine, toasty oak and hazelnut nuances, then finishes with a gush of flavors. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases made. —JL

Intense aromas of ripe berries, tobacco and toasted oak with mineral. Full-bodied, with well-integrated, superfine tannins and a long, long finish. Extremely sexy, yet elegant. Best after 2008. 6,665 cases made. —JS

Wine: Quinta do Noval Late Bottled Port +
Notes: An outstanding LBV. Black in color, with wonderful aromas of blackberries, cherries and licorice, it's full-bodied and medium sweet, with soft tannins and a long finish. Delicious now and will improve with age. Great value considering the quality. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Bodegas Esmeralda Malbec Mendoza Catena Lunlunta Vineyards +
Notes: Serious Malbec. Dense, with a brooding feel to the smoky currant, plum and spice flavors, this Argentine red is really packed with fruit, with ripe, thick tannins coming in on the finish. Just needs a little time to strut its stuff. Best from 2002 through 2004. 9,900 cases made. —JM

Wine: Lawson's Dry Hills Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough +
Notes: Bright and zingy, with lime, green apple and grapefruit flavors mingling nicely right through the lively finish, picking up a welcome touch of cream flavor as well. Drink now. 19,000 cases made. —HS

Wonderful aromas of blackberries, mineral, licorice and fruit lead to a full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, succulent, fruity aftertaste. Generous and rich. Mostly Sangiovese. A consistent top wine from Tuscany. Best after 2004. 8,800 cases made. —JS

Wine: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Crozes-Hermitage Les Jalets +
Notes: Very ripe style. Smells and tastes like licorice, and borders on being raisiny but, oh boy, is this a thick, rich and creamy Rhône red. Full-bodied, inky black and very tannic, delivering lots of fruit and lots of oak, this is a big Syrah. Give it time to settle down. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,415 cases made. —PM

Wine: Tenuta dell'Ornellaia Sauvignon Blanc Toscana Poggio alla Gazze +
Notes: Aromas of peach, flint, gunpowder and ripe fruit come from this full-bodied yet reserved Tuscan white, with fine acidity and a long, long, flavorful finish. A Sauvignon with finesse, like a fine Pouilly-Fumé. Drink now. 6,665 cases made. —JS
Racy and exciting red. Porty. Licorice, berry, coffee, mineral aromas, with hints of wild raspberries. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2008. 3,830 cases made. —JS

Shows serious concentration to its streamlined cassis, briar and currant flavors, framed by suave toast and mineral notes. The flavors really glide on the persistent finish. As good as I've had from the region, and back on form after the subpar '97. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2004. 2,900 cases made. —JM

This young Chardonnay impresses with its ripe, complex flavors—rich layers of fig, honey, apricot, honeysuckle and citrus, turning elegant and sophisticated. Drink now through 2006. 2,100 cases made. —JL

Wine: Domaine de l'Oratoire St.-Martin Côtes du Rhône-Villages Cairanne Cuvée Prestige +
Notes: Beautiful. Rich, ripe, thick and flavorful. The sweet-tasting fruit and lush tannins make for an opulent red with smoke, mineral, grilled meat, plum and blackberry character. Balanced. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made. —PM

Wine: J. Hofstätter Lagrein Alto Adige Steinraffler +
Notes: A blockbuster red. Esoteric. Black-ruby color. Intense aromas of cooked fruits and grilled meat. Full-bodied and very chewy, with a long, long finish. Like a top Syrah. Best after 2003. 1,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Barone Ricasoli Chianti Classico Castello di Brolio +
Notes: Dark ruby color, with lots of chocolate, berry and vanilla aromas, this is full-bodied and velvety, with lots of fruit and a long, succulent finish. A beauty from a great vintage. Best from 2001 through 2006. 17,000 cases made. —JS

This has a laser beam of currant and cassis running through its densely textured palate. Extra notes of cocoa powder, mineral and smoke come in on the finish. Densely structured, but the tannins are sweet and finely grained. A serious wine for the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2006. 12,000 cases made. —JM

Wine: Château La Roque Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup +
Notes: An elegant, well-balanced red, with a chocolaty aroma and pure flavors of red plum and berry. Finishes with brickish and mineral notes. Drink now through 2003. 4,300 cases made. —KM

Wine: Kendall-Jackson Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates +
Notes: A tremendous effort, very rich and full-bodied, with plush tannins wrapped around a complex, concentrated core of earthy currant, toasty oak, hints of sage and chocolate and rich black cherry fruit. Beautifully focused, elegant and tapered on the long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,280 cases made. —JL

Wine: Heitz Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bella Oaks Vineyard +
Notes: Supple and elegant, a very impressive style, with creamy black cherry, currant, plum, olive, dill and spice. Finishes with polished tannins and a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 4,700 cases made. —JL

Subtle aromas of violet, berry and crushed raspberry. Medium- to full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fine finish. Tasted good from barrel, but it's outstanding now. Incredible effort from this estate. Best after 2007. 10,000 cases made. —JS
Intense aromas of rosebushes and fruit. Full-bodied, with plenty of juicy fruit and chewy tannins. Needs time to open. Best after 2005. 6,300 cases made. —JS

Wine: Rex Hill Pinot Noir Willamette Valley +
Notes: Ripe, round and distinctive for its layers of gamy, peppery, spicy notes that surround the rich core of black cherry and blackberry flavors. Tannins are polished, but present. Drink now through 2006. 7,675 cases made. —HS

Wine: Château de Lancyre Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Grande Cuvée +
Notes: A full-bore, meaty French red, showing ripe flavors and aromas of dark plum, cassis and blackberry with exotic spicy and mineral elements. Dark chocolate, roasted plum and espresso notes make for an intense and long-lasting finish. Best from 2002 through 2007. 1,500 cases made. —KM

Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley +
Notes: Harnesses the rich, ripe flavors of Cabernet into a supple, seductive package, layering its dark cherry, plum and spice flavors on a plush frame. The flavors echo endlessly, suggesting this will only get better with cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 2,070 cases made. —HS

Wine: Joh. Jos. Prüm Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr +
Notes: Terrific from start to finish. Aromatic, densely flavored and rich, with slate, lime and peach elements on a seamless, well-defined structure. The finish takes on another dimension, and makes it look effortless. Drink now through 2012. 1,600 cases made. —BS

Wine: Viansa Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Reserve +
Notes: Packs in lots of delicious flavors, with layers of ripe plum, currant, cedar, anise, sage and mineral, finishing with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 2,894 cases made. —JL

Distinctive Châteauneuf, with plenty of wild mushrooms, wet earth, game and leather. This is not a fruit bomb; it has chewy tannins. But underneath is wonderful sweet fruit, as well as a subtle mineral caress. Something special. Best from 2005 through 2015. 13,330 cases made. —PM

Wine: Chateau St. Jean Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Cinq Cépages +
Notes: Gorgeous Cabernet, offering a mix of ripe, rich, fleshy currant and blackberry fruit, with hints of herb, olive and sage. Finishes with a firm, structured backbone and ripe tannins giving it depth and richness. Drink now through 2014. 13,000 cases made. —JL

A Brunello for everyone. Solid and focused, with mineral, blackberry and licorice character. Full-bodied and very chunky, with lots of round tannins and a long, long finish. Needs time to open. Best after 2003. 32,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Antinori Brunello di Montalcino Pian delle Vigne +
Notes: Amazing Brunello. Fantastic aromas of blackberries, flowers and minerals. Captivating. Full-bodied, with incredible layers of ripe fruit and silky tannins. The finish last for minutes. Racy and firm now. Give it some bottle age. Best from 2004 through 2014. 12,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Columbia Crest Chardonnay Columbia Valley Grand Estates +
Notes: Rich and creamy, a plush mouthful of peach, pear, nutmeg and cream flavors that wind themselves nicely all the way through the generous finish. Inexpensive and more than plentiful. Drink now through 2003. 185,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Silverado Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Delicious black cherry, spicy plum and blackberry flavors are well-centered, offering depth and richness and finishing with firm tannins wrapped around a core of mocha-laced oak. Drink now through 2009. 16,934 cases made. —JL

Wine: Domenico Clerico Barolo Ciabot Mentin Ginestra +
Notes: Breathtaking. Big and powerful, with loads of plum, blackberry, raisin and meat aromas. Full-bodied, with big, luscious tannins and masses of fruit on the palate. Long and rich. Seductive. Best after 2007. 1,400 cases made. —JS

Warm and exciting wine from a slightly frigid vintage. Black ruby color. Rich and powerful nose, with loads of currant, smoke and tobacco. Full-bodied and silky, polished and long. Best after 2005. 15,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Pine Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District +
Notes: A tour de force. Deliciously rich and complex, with layers of juicy plum, black cherry, currant and wild berry shaded by anise, cedar, earth and mineral flavors, it fairly gushes with fruit on the finish, yet should age gracefully for another decade, maybe more. Best from 2004 through 2015. 5,067 cases made. —JL

Dusty berry, currant, anise and cedary oak aromas follow through to a rich, concentrated core of flavors on the palate; yet for all its weight, there's a sense of suppleness and grace, with a rich curranty aftertaste. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,240 cases made. —JL

Complex aromas of blackberries, tobacco, spices and black licorice are alluring in this full-bodied claret, with a solid core of fruit and silky tannins. Long, caressing finish. Superfine, well-structured. Best after 2006. 22,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve +
Notes: An enormously complex and sophisticated wine that combines great flavors with uncommon finesse. Dark, sleek, rich and polished, with a delicious core of concentrated cola, currant, plum and blackberry. Tremendous finish. Best from 2004 through 2014. 20,000 cases made. —JL

A wine of great intensity, depth and complexity. Beautifully crafted, ripe, rich and creamy, showing off pretty vanilla and mocha-scented oak before a deep core of currant, blackberry, black cherry and minerally flavors fold in. Firm tannins add structure on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2014. 7,000 cases made. —JL

Rich and spicy, with exotic chocolate, black cherry, plum, nutmeg and light toasty, mocha-scented oak and coffee grounds. Elegant, complex and concentrated, it's a mouthful of Merlot that should age well for another decade. Firm, chewy tannins sneak up on you. Best from 2003 through 2012. 27,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo +
Notes: Superbly crafted. Pretty aromas of black cherry, cream and licorice. Full-bodied, yet incredibly tight and smooth, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long, velvety finish. Best after 2004. 12,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Whitehall Lane Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: An immense effort, dark, rich and deeply concentrated, packed with layers of rich currant, chocolate, mocha, cherry and herbal nuances. Finishes with a powerful, persistent aftertaste, rich, ripe tannins and wonderful complexity. Best from 2003 through 2012. 12,280 cases made. —JL

Big wine, but so refined and sleek, it comes across as delicate on the palate. Plenty of finely tuned oak, with vanilla, chocolate and mocha aromas that blend into the sweet red and blackberry to produce a classy and satiny wine that is surprisingly aristocratic for this appellation. Like a charming red Burgundy from Chambolle-Musigny. Drink now through 2010. 17,165 cases made. —PM

Sleek, yet deceptively rich and complex. Deeply concentrated and full of ripe fig, pear, citrus, light toasty oak and hazelnut flavors. Sharply focused and long on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,800 cases made. —JL

Complex aromas of grilled meat and cherry, with hints of cedar and tobacco turning to plums and flowers. Full-bodied and extremely well-structured, with well-integrated tannins and ripe and concentrated fruit. Superbly made. Best after 2004. 2,200 cases made. —JS

Full-throttle Chardonnay, with all the Burgundy treatment (like a juicy Meursault) you could hope for. Loads of apple, vanilla and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with loads of fruit and a long, butterscotch and ripe fruit aftertaste. Glorious. Drink now. 6,700 cases made. —JS

Wine: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso +
Notes: Beautiful, with blackberry, perfumed violet and milk chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of jammy, chocolaty fruit and big, velvety tannins. Lasts for minutes on the palate. Glorious now, but will age for a very long time. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Spring Valley Uriah Walla Walla Valley +
Notes: Ultrasmooth and gently spicy, a gorgeous rainbow of plum, cherry, cedar, chocolate and exotic spice flavors that play across a supple frame, polished to a deep sheen and echoing forever. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made. —HS

Wine: Peter Michael Les Pavots Knights Valley +
Notes: Deliciously rich, smooth and polished. Deeply concentrated, with layers of currant, blackberry, mocha and vanilla. Beautifully focused and deftly balanced, the flavors run on and on. Best from 2004 through 2013. 2,164 cases made. —JL

Smooth-textured, with polished currant, mocha, cranberry and cherry, plus touches of tobacco, coffee and spice. A bit tough-edged with tannin, but certainly not out of line for a young wine. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Hartwell Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District Estate +
Notes: Absolutely gorgeous, beautifully defined fruit, with uncommon richness and purity of flavor, gushing with ripe currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit, revealing extra facets and dimensions, with a long, intricate, detailed finish. Firmly tannic, but a wealth of fruit pushes through. Best from 2003 through 2012. 1,300 cases made. —JL

Deceptively sleek, rich and polished for all its youthful vitality and intensity. Packed with rich currant, cherry, mocha and coffee flavors, it has a deep, complex midpalate, and then the tannins flex their considerable muscles. Best from 2003 through 2012. 4,100 cases made. —JL

Wine: Casanova di Neri Brunello di Montalcino Tenuta Nuova +
Notes: Like finely meshed cashmere. Exotic aromas of plums, incense and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with very fine tannins and a long, caressing, silky aftertaste. A wine with loads of finesse. Give it time. Best after 2004. 4,580 cases made. —JS

Wine: Leeuwin Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series +
Notes: Brilliant, juicy and multilayered, brimming with apple, pear, tropical fruit, almond, mineral and spice flavors that swirl together on a muscular but lithe and seamless frame. The flavors last and last. Has depth, length and power without being at all bulky. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made. —HS

Fantastic. Very ripe and rich, with raisin and cured beef character. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A massive but impressive red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2005. 3,250 cases made. —JS

Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley +
Notes: Rich in flavor and beautifully focused to show its currant, plum and berry flavors, which cascade juicily and generously on the long, long finish. All of it balances impeccably. Drink now through 2008. 2,030 cases made. —HS

Fantastic white. Lovely aromas of fresh green apples, grapefruit and peaches. Full-bodied and very rich, with intense fruit and a long, long finish. A super Soave. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made. —JS

Wonderfully rich, intense and concentrated Cabernet, with layers of tightly focused currant, black cherry, anise, sage and cedary oak. Given all its flavor and richness, there's a sense of elegance and finesse. Well-integrated tannins provide an excellent balance to the rich flavors. Best from 2003 through 2012. 2,443 cases made. —JL

With firm texture and beautiful focus, this powerful, seamless wine has a distinctly gamy note weaving through the ripe, peppery currant and plum flavors. Finishes with chewy tannins. Best from 2004 through 2010. 4,000 cases made. —HS

Dark, rich and enormously complex, with a solid core of black cherry, plum, currant, anise and cedar flavors. Beautifully focused, with a sense of elegance and finesse. Best from 2003 through 2010. 8,400 cases made. —JL

Wine: Columbia Crest Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve +
Notes: Plump and generous, dark-colored and amazingly supple, offering pretty plum, blackberry and sweet spice flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made. —HS

Smooth, rich and elegant. This is a supple, deeply flavored, harmonious wine, with focused currant, cassis and blackberry flavors that are pure and succulent. Finishing with ripe, well-integrated tannins and a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2012. 6,950 cases made. —JL

A bit more aristocratic than most Aussie Shirazes, this one strikes a beautiful chord of rich blackberry and currant fruit, hinting at anise and pepper. Has a fleshy frame, with sweet spicy notes darting in and out through the long, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Joseph Phelps Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: A rich, deftly balanced style, loaded with complex earthy currant, black cherry, anise, coffee and mocha flavors that are sharply focused. Long and concentrated on the finish, with a leathery streak working its way in. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Pine Ridge Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Dijon Clones +
Notes: A bold mouthful of Chardonnay that packs in lots of rich, complex flavors that are concentrated and deep. Smoky toasty oak, pear, fig, sage and anise turn thick and buttery. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made. —JL

Jazzy, snazzy and vibrant. A juicy mouthful of grapefruit, pear and sweet pea, with aromas and flavors that linger on and on, as the finish finds a wonderful equilibrium. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle Merlot Columbia Valley Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard +
Notes: Rich, round and generous with its ripe blackberry, cherry and sweet spice flavors, which echo beautifully on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2006. 10,000 cases made. —HS
Very well-done. Bright fruit, with hints of dry porcini that turn to blackberries. Full-bodied, with loads of silky tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2005. 1,600 cases made. —JS

Clearly made in Burgundy, this is a savage wine, a highly distinctive Chardonnay. Immensely powerful, penetrating the palate with a concentrated lemon, honey, wet earth, ripe fruit combination. Full-bodied, it lasts for over a minute on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2020. 1,300 cases made. —PM

Wine: Concha y Toro Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Marqués de Casa Concha +
Notes: Delicious Old World-style Cab, with ripe currant and cassis fruit accentuated by mineral, loam, smoke and earth notes. Ripe and juicy, with lovely mouthfeel, and the tug of gout de terroir on the finish. Back-to-back outstanding efforts for this wine. Drink now through 2005. 24,500 cases made. —JM
