A gentle giant of a wine. Subtle and elegant Hermitage, layered with seductive aromas and flavors, from tobacco to green olive, roasted game, mineral and blackberries. Silky mouthfeel, this medium-bodied red is smooth, yet also fresh on the long finish. Will age for years. Drink now through 2015. 7,330 cases made. —PM

Wine: Paringa Shiraz South Australia Individual Vineyard +
Notes: Smooth and generous, an inviting red that's plump with black cherry, blackberry and exotic spice flavors, hinting at dark chocolate as the flavors persist on the fine-grained finish. Outstanding. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made. —HS

Very rich and distinctive, with spicy currant, leather, tobacco, cedar and mocha aromas and complex, concentrated, earth, currant, spice and cedar flavors. Gains depth and nuance on the finish, where the flavors run deep and long. Tannins are firm and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made. —JL

Big and ripe red, with loads of black licorice, tar and sultanas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety, chewy tannins. Long, ripe fruit aftertaste. A blockbuster. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 3,750 cases made. —JS

Wine: Domaine Drouhin Pinot Noir Oregon Laurène +
Notes: Rich and intense, highly focused to project its aromas and flavors without being heavy. Centers on dazzling raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and roasted game notes that harmonize beautifully on the lively finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,700 cases made. —HS

So sleek and clean, this full-bodied red combines beautifully spicy fruit, black currant, licorice and a touch of eucalyptus. Light-footed, it glides on the palate to a long and elegant finish. Seductive. Drink now through 2007. 1,220 cases made. —PM

Wine: Bodegas Esmeralda Chardonnay Mendoza Catena Agrelo Vineyards +
Notes: Delicious stuff. Juicy, with fig, pineapple and pear flavors, fat texture, and a long, bright finish that lets the flavors hang on. Drink now through 2003. 14,000 cases made. —JM

Pretty aromas of plums, berries and cherries follow through to a full-bodied palate, with a lovely balance of ripe fruit and refined tannins. Long and caressing finish. Drink now. 5,380 cases made. —JS
Bright, ripe and zingy, with grapefruit, pear and celery notes that linger enticingly through the vivid finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Chimney Rock Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District +
Notes: Dark, rich and polished, with ripe currant, black cherry, plum and mocha. It's dense and concentrated, with a long, focused and persistent stream of flavors. Ripe tannins are plush and complex. Best from 2004 through 2012. 9,200 cases made. —JL

Wine: Seghesio Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine +
Notes: A big, ripe, expressive style that packs in lots of spicy blackberry and black cherry fruit, and manages a measure of elegance and finesse given its size and intensity. Finishes with hints of herb and tea. Drink now through 2009. 4,000 cases made. —JL

A particularly generous New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc that jumps with ripe pear, citrus and passion fruit aromas and flavors, remarkable for its intensity and freshness. Drink now. 10,000 cases made. —HS

Dark and intense, with a tight, compact, tightly wound band of earth, anise, leather, game meat, currant and blackberry, revealing layers of complexity and concentration before the tannins and cedary oak clamp down. Best from 2005 through 2014. 2,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Penfolds Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Thomas Hyland +
Notes: Silky, supple and creamy, beautifully balanced to layer its intense nectarine, pear, lime and cream flavors, which linger effortlessly on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2008. 14,390 cases imported. —HS

A wine of finesse and elegance, with intense, vibrant fruit that's ripe and rich, with layers of smoky toasty oak, honeysuckle, fig and melon, turning subtle and polished. Drink now through 2005. 9,630 cases made. —JL

Wine: Shafer Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch +
Notes: Intense and spicy, with an underlying sense of elegance and finesse. Layers of nutmeg and cedary oak match up well with a core of ripe pear, fig, citrus and apricot, finishing with a long, rich, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 7,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: S. Anderson Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District +
Notes: Dark, intense and concentrated, with a beefy, peppery edge to the plush currant, mineral, earth and blackberry. Shows of lots of flavor and depth, finishing with a strong currant and mineral aftertaste, and rich tannins. Best from 2004 through 2012. 1,473 cases made. —JL
Lively, jazzy style absolutely brims with racy lime, green apple, passion fruit and guava flavors, which linger effortlessly on the polished, vibrant finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made. —HS

Beautiful aromas of minerals, berries and violets, with just the right amount of toasted oak. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins, but slightly austere on the finish. Best after 2002. 14,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle-Dr. Loosen Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica +
Notes: Bright and tangy, with an uncanny balance that finds the right mix of peach, pear and mineral flavors, juicy but nicely concealed acidity, and enough richness to make it all sing through the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,000 cases made. —HS
Bright and juicy, this white is a lively mouthful of melon, citrus, pepper and passion fruit flavors, which linger on the appealing finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Louis M. Martini Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Monte Rosso Vineyard Family Vineyard Selection +
Notes: Impressive for its rich, tight, deeply concentrated core of spice- and anise-laced currant and blackberry flavors. Sharply focused, intense and concentrated, its mouthfilling fruit flavors are long and complex on the finish, with well-integrated tannins. Best from 2004 through 2014. 1,365 cases made. —JL
Rich, concentrated yet elegant style, with waves of ripe flavors, supple coffee, currant, black cherry and anise, finishing with dense tannins. Drink now through 2010. 6,400 cases made. —JL

Intense aromas of ripe fruit, flowers and hints of wood. Full-bodied, with rich, silky tannins and a long, long finish. A tight and well-structured red for aging. Best after 2004. 3,250 cases made. —JS
Gorgeous aromas of blackberries, violets and currants lead to this full-bodied wine with velvety tannins. Lovely finish delivers a juicy berry aftertaste. Best after 2004. 16,000 cases made. —JS

Smooth and silky, with ripe, rich blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors that are pure and well-focused. Finishes with a long, concentrated aftertaste, with elegant tannins. Drink now through 2009. 50,000 cases made. —JL

A supple, elegant style, with a range of herb, currant and green olive that offers complexity, picking up anise, earth and mineral flavors. Pleasantly balanced on the finish. A wine of grace and delicacy. Drink now through 2009. 9,800 cases made. —JL

Powerful oaky flavors dominate this red now, but they wrap around a core of luscious raspberry and blackberry fruit flavors, and the texture is smooth and opulent. An ambitious wine in the modern style. Carignane, Grenache, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,300 cases made. —TM

Wine: Penfolds Shiraz South Australia Kalimna Bin 28 +
Notes: Rich and ripe, plush in texture, brimming with cherry, mineral and licorice flavors, wrapping extrafine tannins around the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 13,000 cases imported. —HS

A ripe, intense, fruit-driven style, with racy, jammy black cherry and blackberry fruit that's well-focused, picking up pretty toasty oak, tar and leather shadings. Holds its focus nicely. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made. —JL

A richly flavored yet elegantly crafted wine that's sleek and polished, with ripe pear, fig, honeysuckle and honeydew flavors that turn smooth and creamy, picking up subtle nutmeg and hazelnut nuances on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,466 cases made. —JL

Wine: Beringer Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release +
Notes: A rich, complex and deeply concentrated style, with layers of pear, fig, smoke, apricot and honey. Bold and intriguing, it's a mouthful of Chardonnay that both relies on oak and carries it well. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Argyle Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve +
Notes: Bright and tangy, a complex and detailed Pinot that sneaks up on you. It is especially appealing for its citrus-scented raspberry and chocolate flavors, which linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,902 cases made. —HS

Wine: Brothers In Arms Shiraz Langhorne Creek +
Notes: Rich and delicious, a lip-smacking mouthful of blackberry, currant, blueberry and plum flavors wrapped in a blanket of exotic spices, with hints of coffee and chocolate. Tannins are fine and chewy. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Sebastiani Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Appellation Selection +
Notes: Wonderful richness, depth and purity of flavor. Shows layers of black cherry, ripe plum, raspberry and currant, as well as touches of anise and herb. Vanilla and cedar-scented oak linger in the background. Ripe tannins emerge on the long, complex, elegant finish. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,500 cases made. —JL

Wine: Leonetti Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley +
Notes: Rich and ripe, packed with beautiful currant and berry flavors, framed with superfine tannins that let the fruit and subtly spicy overtones linger effortlessly on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,329 cases made. —HS

Wine: Franciscan Oakville Estate Chardonnay Napa Valley Cuvée Sauvage +
Notes: Rich, elegant and stylish, with pretty hazelnut, toasty marshmallow, pear, fig and citrus flavors that are nicely proportioned. Drink now through 2007. 3,600 cases made. —JL

Gorgeous from start to finish. An explosive wine that delivers lemon, ripe fruit, and toasted oak (in manageable doses). Sweet-tasting, but with an impressive mineral note. Beautiful, long, succulent finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported. —PM

Wine: Villa Mt. Eden Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve +
Notes: Orchestrates an assortment of ripe cherry, blackberry and currant flavors in a smooth texture. Has fine tannins, picking up toasty, cedary oak on the finish, providing backbone. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,500 cases made. —JL

This luscious red offers vanilla, rose and berry aromas that carry through on the creamy palate. Ripe tannins underpin the fruit, but melt into the mix. A spicy, floral finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2007. 18,000 cases made. —TM

This Portuguese red bursts in the mouth with intense flavors of cassis, berry and red cherry that are powered by a strong backbone of acidity. Finish of game and bittersweet chocolate. Almost Burgundian in its elegance and balance. Best from 2003 through 2008. 5,000 cases made. —KM

Displays very good concentration for the vintage. Aromatic, with plum, currant and tar character, the wine is medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Super buy. Best after 2003. 21,665 cases made. —JS

Very fine indeed, offering complex aromas of berries, grilled meat and tobacco, with racy tannins and a long finish. Medium- to full-bodied. Better than from barrel. Best after 2005. 18,715 cases made. —JS

Beautiful aromas of sweet plums, licorice and minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of vanilla and berry character, fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Delicious. Give it some time to come together. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 10,415 cases made. —JS

Distinctive, packed with currant, cocoa, mineral and meat flavors, followed by ripe, finely grained tannins and a lingering espresso note on the lengthy finish. Concentrated, yet elegant and pure, with grip to spare. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2003 through 2007. 4,600 cases made. —JM

Ripe, rich and expressive style, with loads of tropical fruit, pear, fig, apricot and buttery oak, all neatly woven together. The texture is smooth and polished, with a long, detailed, citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 13,400 cases made. —JL

Wine: Antinori Umbria White Cervaro della Sala +
Notes: Wonderful aromas of apple pie, honey and cream follow through to a full body, with toasted coconut and rich tropical fruit on the palate. Very long. Always an excellent white. Chardonnay and Grechetto. Drink now. 13,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Burgess Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Vintage Selection +
Notes: Ripe, rich and polished, with a tasty array of complex currant, plum and wild berry flavors that are sharply focused, long and detailed on the finish. Tannins are sufficient for cellaring, yet neatly woven into the texture. Beautifully crafted. Best from 2003 through 2012. 6,200 cases made. —JL
Incredibly well-crafted red. Complex aromas of raspberries, vanilla and coffee. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, silky finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 4,250 cases made. —JS

Wine: Feudi di San Gregorio Greco di Tufo +
Notes: An outstanding modern-style wine from an ancient Italian grape variety. Wonderful aromas of blanched almonds, dried peach, pineapple and minerals. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely fresh fruit, flinty character and a long, long finish. Excellent. Drink now. 66,650 cases made. —JS

Clean and balanced. Beautiful aromas of plums, flowers and fresh-brewed Indian tea. Medium-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 20,000 cases made. —JS
Pretty berry and spicy aromas follow through to a medium to full body, with well-integrated tannins and a coffee, plum and truffle aftertaste. Best after 2005. 7,200 cases made. —JS

Rich, complex, refined yet flavor-packed style, with lots of rich pear, fig, hazelnut and melon flavors accented by spicy, toasty oak. Finishes with a long, detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 60,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Bodegas Mauro Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León +
Notes: Harmony and finesse mark this elegant red. It offers black cherry, toast and spice flavors over firm tannins, with a grace that almost hides its intensity. A lovely wine in the modern style. Drink now through 2009. 13,000 cases made. —TM

A magnificent Merlot, with gorgeous fruit that's ripe, rich and distinctive. The bounty of complex flavors includes enticing black cherry, currant, blackberry and spice, with a smooth chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 2,510 cases made. —JL

Smells like freshly picked orchids, with loads of ripe, clean fruit. Full-bodied, medium sweet and very powerful and racy. It lasts for minutes on your palate. Yet there's a balance and class to this young Vintage Port. This is the greatest glass of Graham I have ever tasted, young or old. Best after 2014. 9,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Casa Lapostolle Clos Apalta Rapel Valley +
Notes: A stunner. This coats the palate with cassis, blackberry and boysenberry fruit, but stays focused and pure, with vanilla, spice and toast notes chiming in on the palate for added effect. The finish then resonates with purity. A thoroughly seductive wine that glides effortlessly, despite its obvious power and depth. Carmenère, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases made. —JM

Suave, sophisticated, rich and concentrated, but remains balanced and polished, with bright blueberry and blackberry flavors supported by toasty, vanilla-scented oak. A modern wine with great structure and harmony. Best after 2005. 1,800 cases made. —TM

Absolutely gorgeous on the nose, with currants, blackberries and freshly cut flowers. Full-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a solid core of fruit. This goes on and on on the palate. The essence of class and refinement. Relatively good value, considering the superb quality. No better Cos since 1989. Best after 2010. 20,830 cases made. —JS

Absolutely fantastic. This is one of the most exciting young reds I have tasted in a long, long time. It shows intense aromas of berries, currants and minerals, with hints of mint. Full-bodied and packed with fruit and tannins, its long finish is refined and silky. A benchmark for the vintage. Las Cases has always wanted to make first-growth quality in a top-notch vintage, and it certainly did in 2000. Best after 2012. 15,000 cases made. —JS

Rich in character and aristocratic in structure, a noble red that wears its subtle cherry, blackberry, chocolate, pepper and sweet spice flavors on a polished frame like a bespoke suit, letting them all play out elegantly on the well-buffed finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,800 cases made. —HS

Wine: Two Hands Shiraz Barossa Valley Bella's Garden +
Notes: Rich, dense and distinctive for its pepper and exotic spice notes weaving through the chewy cherry pie, dried blueberry and coffee flavors, echoing forever on the long, long finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases imported. —HS

Blockbuster. Both modern and traditional, a full-bodied red that bridges the past and the present. This is packed with Turkish delight dessert, ripe and sweet fruit, lush tannins, with lots of spicy, smoky character and a round, caressing feel in the midpalate. Best from 2006 through 2012. 5,830 cases made. —PM

Dark, with fantastic aromas of currant, blackberry, spice and lightly toasty oak. Full-bodied, with very well-integrated tannins and a texture as fine as the best cashmere from Scotland. Superb. Needs time in the bottle to show its full potential. One of the new hot wines of Tuscany. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2008. 3,330 cases made. —JS

The nose shows loads of plum, spice and meat aromas, as well as hints of licorice. It's full-bodied, with firm, yet velvety textured tannins. It's big and rounded. If you can't afford Las Cases, try some of this. Some might call this a second wine, but it comes from a plot of vineyards not deemed worthy of Léoville Las Cases. So it's like its own estate. Best after 2009. 20,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Aubert Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Ritchie Vineyard +
Notes: Wonderful aromas of flowers, honeysuckle, fig, butter and hazelnut. Rich, silky flavors that are elegant and refined, with a creamy, citrus-laced finish. Vibrant acidity gives it backbone and sustains the flavors on a long, minerally aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 702 cases made. —JL

Tangy, with bold citrus, melon, green apple and mineral flavors that grow as they linger effortlessly. Beautifully put together, this has all the earmarks of becoming great with cellaring. Best from 2005 through 2010. 600 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Château La Roque Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Cupa Numismae +
Notes: Pure, intense red, with delicious red plum, berry, game and spice flavors on a muscular frame. Pepper and leathery notes linger appealingly on the finish. Almost Hermitage-like in its structure. Drink now through 2006. 4,700 cases made. —KM

Wine: Chateau Souverain Chardonnay Russian River Valley Winemaker's Reserve +
Notes: A rich, flamboyant style, from its wonderful aromatics to its opulent display of fruit and oak flavors. The mix of fleshy pear, fig and smoky oak combine to open all kinds of flavor doors. Finishes with mineral and lemon-citrus scents. Drink now through 2006. 1,958 cases made. —JL

Wine: Joh. Jos. Prüm Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr +
Notes: A completely seductive and appealing '01 spätlese. Seamless and airy in texture, yet layered with peach, citrus and mineral aromas and flavors enmeshed in the delicate frame. Lovely finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made. —BS

Wine: Spring Valley Uriah Walla Walla Valley +
Notes: Gloriously ripe, decadent and complex, offering coffee-scented blackberry, currant, cherry and exotic spice aromas and flavors that extend and expand on the subtle, elegant finish. A graceful wine that packs in plenty of flavor and lasts and lasts. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2010. 900 cases made. —HS

Wine: Château de Flaugergues Coteaux du Languedoc La Méjanelle Cuvée Sommelière +
Notes: Full-bore, decadent red, with dark plum and blackberry flavors. Bacon fat notes mixed in. Rich, deep and lush, with dark chocolate and espresso notes on the finish. Powerful. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made. —KM

Deep purple, with loads of ripe plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors, scents of violets, dark fruits, new leather, currants and minerals. A real mouthful that manages to show elegance and a measure of finesse. Long, gushing aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 850 cases made. —JL

Essence of blackberry, dark cherry and smoke make this an alluring and distinctive red. Intense concentration and a firm structure provide loads of power. Dark chocolate notes dominate the finish. Still quite youthful, but should develop nicely in the years ahead. Best from 2004 through 2008. 3,000 cases made. —KM

Wine: H. Dönnhoff Riesling Spätlese Nahe Niederhäuser Hermannshöhle +
Notes: A beautifully understated spätlese, with subtle power, density and length. The passion fruit, sweet corn, berry, fennel and mineral notes are layered and just keep coming at you. Superbly balanced, it seems effortless and ethereal. The finish just melts away. Best from 2005 through 2020. 250 cases made. —BS

Now we are talking. Wow. Aromas of licorice, flowers and crushed blackberries. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with lovely smooth, fine tannins and a long, sweet fruit finish. Greatest young Vintage Port of Smith Woodhouse I have ever tasted. Best after 2014. 4,000 cases made. —JS

A dense and rich red, with aromas of blackberries and blueberries, with an undertone of minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of tannins and loads of structure and length. Just a baby, but already muscular and developed. Best wine from this estate in years. Same owner as Léoville Barton. Best after 2010. 7,580 cases made. —JS

Wine: Patz & Hall Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch +
Notes: An uncommonly rich, almost sweet-tasting Chardonnay that packs in lots of flavors yet manages to be elegant and refined. It offers layers of fig, apricot and ripe pear, shaded by exotic spices and pretty oak. Drink now through 2007. 3,886 cases made. —JL

Wine: Rosenblum Zinfandel San Francisco Bay Carla's Vineyards +
Notes: Dark and chocolaty, with zesty wild berry and blackberry fruit and lots of spice and espresso scents. The long, rich, concentrated aftertaste showcases the exotic fruit flavors. Drink now through 2008. 2,100 cases made. —JL

Incredibly rich, with masses of ripe fruit on the nose, from plum to blackberry, showing smoky oak undertones. Full-bodied, with layers of silky, ripe tannins and a long, fruity, almost jammy finish. A real triumph. Moccagatta is a leader in Barbaresco right now, and this is one of the greatest wines ever from this producer. Best after 2010. 550 cases made. —JS
Very, very impressive for this estate. Blackberry and cigar tobacco, with hints of toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long finish. Best after 2010. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Yangarra Park Shiraz McLaren Vale Appellation Series +
Notes: Rich and plump, a flood of fruit, with powerful blackberry, plum and a wee touch of peppermint, all echoing through the long finish. A serious McLaren Vale Shiraz, built to last. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made. —HS

Extremely well-done. Beautifully aromatic, with coffee, cedar and blackberries on the nose. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a mineral, blackberry aftertaste with medium fine tannins. I haven't had a Lagrange of this quality in years. Best after 2010. 25,000 cases made. —JS

Ultrarich and ultrathick. A full-bodied, stunningly sweet-tasting Northern Rhône, it delivers a ripe mouthfeel and plenty of fruit, mineral and toasty, smoky character. Long, balanced finish. Great Hermitage red from Guigal. Drink now through 2012. 4,580 cases made. —PM

Wine: Casanuova delle Cerbaie Brunello di Montalcino +
Notes: Big and concentrated red, with plum, berry, currants and cherry character. Full-bodied, with thick tannins and a long, rich finish. Dense wine. As impressive as the 1997. Best after 2004. 2,250 cases made. —JS

Wine: Montus Bouscassé Madiran Château Bouscassé Vieilles Vignes +
Notes: Powerful and well-structured red, with dark plum, smoke and dark cherry flavors, and loads of meat and coffee notes. Full-bodied, with licorice and mocha elements on the long, long finish. Best from 2004 through 2007. 6,600 cases made. —KM

Wine: Albino Rocca Barbaresco Vigneto Brich Ronchi +
Notes: Very attractive aromas of ripe plum, berry and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with lovely fruit and big, silky tannins. The finish is fantastic, with very ripe fruit, yet refined and caressing in texture. Best after 2008. 2,080 cases made. —JS

Wine: Mount Eden Vineyards Chardonnay Edna Valley West Slope Edna Ranch +
Notes: Remarkably complex and elegant, with a delicious range of flavors built around vibrant pear, nectarine, honeysuckle, creamy fig and light toasty-hazelnut scented oak. Turns sleek and vibrant, with a wonderful aftertaste of complex flavors. Drink now through 2005. 4,362 cases made. —JL

Old-fashioned, this full-bodied traditional wine seduces with its decadent game, saddle-leather, plum and sautéed wild mushroom aromas. No hint of fancy oak, just a mouthful of Châteauneuf character that swirls around to a long, sweet finish. Another great négoce red from Guigal. Drink now through 2008. 23,330 cases made. —PM

Crackling, live-wire Sauvignon, with textbook gooseberry, grass, lime and mineral flavors on a racy frame. Pure and long, with great acidity rippling beneath it all. Let this emerge fully in the cellar. Best from 2004 through 2006. 11,500 cases made. —JM

Wine: d'Arenberg Shiraz McLaren Vale The Footbolt Old Vine +
Notes: Bright and jazzy, with delicious blackberry and cherry and subtle touches of anise and pepper weaving through the lively, long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi Chianti Rufina Montesodi +
Notes: A beauty. Dark, with beautiful aromas of blackberry, mineral and spice. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and tannins and a long, long finish. Pure Sangiovese. Best after 2006. 5,800 cases made. —JS

Absolutely wonderful aromas of flowers, currants and citrus. Full-bodied, yet very, very refined, with a center core of fruit that tastes like crushed raspberries and goes on and on. Greatest wine from this estate since 1945. Best after 2010. 18,750 cases made. —JS

Wine: Nobilo Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Icon Series +
Notes: Brisk, floral style brims with pear, grapefruit and passion fruit aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made. —HS

Layers and layers of fruit. Intense aromas of blackberry, tobacco, mineral and dried mushroom. Full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and rich and wonderful fruit. Long, long finish. Goes on and on. I like it better than the outstanding 1998. Clerico is a master again. Best after 2010. 550 cases made. —JS

Wine: Chéreau-Carré Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Château de Chasseloir +
Notes: This Muscadet offers rare explosiveness, with concentrated lemon peel, grapefruit, honeysuckle, mineral and briny notes. The racy acidity carries it along effortlessly, while a second wave of fruit emerges on the finish. Hard for Muscadet to be better than this. Drink now through 2004. 15,000 cases made. —JM

Like a laser beam, this wine zaps the palate with ripe apple, peach, citrus and mineral notes, then exits as cleanly as it entered, leaving you wanting more. Drink now through 2006. 3,800 cases made. —BS

Seductive, elegant and refined, with subtle but rich flavors, in a full-bodied package that includes ripe fruit, spice, smoke, plum and quince pie. Tightly wound (but sweet) tannins, and a burst of mineral make this particularly long and clean on the finish. Best from 2007 through 2020. 16,665 cases made. —PM

Bright and generous. Impressively balanced to show touches of ripe melon against tart grapefruit and lime flavors that echo nicely on the lively, delicately herbal finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Dr. Loosen Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr +
Notes: Gorgeous balance and grace in this peach- and mineral-flavored Riesling. Great clarity and delicacy defy the amount of flavors deftly positioned on its lightweght frame. Plenty of snap and a chalky texture on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: Lingenfelder Riesling QbA Pfalz Bird Label +
Notes: Brilliance and clarity highlight this Riesling, whose peach, grapefruit and spice notes are brought into focus against the vivid structure. Subtle, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 5,000 cases made. —BS

Really fine Sauvignon here--juicy and vibrant, with lemon, chive, chalk, nettle and mineral notes, and a long, lively finish. Strong grassy edge to the finish adds dimension. Drink now through 2004. 11,000 cases made. —JM

Wine: Columbia Crest Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve +
Notes: Supple and seductive, a lush mouthful of blackberry, blueberry and plum flavors shaded with some subtlety by black pepper, olive and vanilla notes, all of it lingering effortlessly on the remarkably refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made. —HS

Rich, bacony aromas and flavors mix with alluring dark plum and red cherry flavors in this broad-tasting, full-bodied red. Intense blood, iron and mineral notes linger with spicy elements on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases imported. —KM

Impressive. A sophisticated red, with a modern accent, showing vanilla, mocha, chocolate and smoke, all of which complement nicely the ripe and sweet fruit. Full-bodied, clean and racy. Harmonious finish. Drink now through 2015. 6,500 cases made. —PM

This is a powerhouse, with lemon curd, chamomile, honeysuckle, white peach and mineral notes on an incredibly lush frame, yet it's all supported by riveting acidity underneath. Terrific cut and length here, with remarkable persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,915 cases made. —JM

Lots to like here, with citrus peel, straw, mineral, lemon curd and peach notes. This bouncy Sancerre has length, vibrancy and balance and begs for food. Delicious. Drink now through 2005. 30,000 cases made. —JM

Blackberry fruit claims center stage in this powerful red, where it mingles with tobacco and coffee notes and plenty of smoky oak. Massive tannins give structure, but the fruit reemerges on the finish. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases imported. —TM

Fabulous bottle. Very, very classy aromas of freshly cut flowers, crushed berries, with hints of cedar. Full-bodied, yet extremely reserved, with fine tannins and impressive fruit. However, it's all in balance. It goes on and on. Best after 2005. 833 cases made. —JS

Super effort. Complex aromas of milk chocolate, plum and coffee, with hints of game. Full-bodied, soft and round tannins, with a ripe fruit finish. Lovely wine. Best after 2005. 12,675 cases made. —JS

Beautiful white Burgundy, incredibly ripe yet very pure and showing lovely mineral character. Some toasted oak, but mostly ripe pear, tropical and lime notes. Full-bodied, it sings on the palate to a long, long juicy and sweet finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,200 cases made. —PM

Wine: Concha y Toro Merlot Peumo Marqués de Casa Concha +
Notes: Smoky and ripe, with black currant and plum fruit, hints of herbs, cocoa and toast, and fleshy, mouthfilling finish. Feels like it has the stuffing to cellar a bit too. This label is really strong these days. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made. —JM

A bright and fruity Soave, with ripe apple and apricot character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a long finish. You don't get better than this for value in Italian whites. Drink now. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Seghesio Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine +
Notes: Terrific range of flavors, excellent balance and a wonderful sense of harmony. The mix of blackberry, black cherry, anise, sage and toast make this a most inviting wine. Not shy on muscle or tannic backbone, either, as it's quite chewy on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 7,800 cases made. —JL

Loads of crushed raspberries, minerals and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, and concentrated, yet very refined and tight. A lovely elegant claret. Seriously good. Best after 2005. 13,330 cases made. —JS

Wine: J. & F. Lurton Toro El Albar Excelencia +
Notes: A beauty, in the international style. Dark color, lavish oak, ripe fruit and muscular structure mark this red. Flavors range from cassis to chocolate to mineral. Balanced and deep. Best from 2005 through 2010. 1,500 cases made. —TM

Wine: Viña Montes Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Alpha Apalta Vineyard +
Notes: Lovely fruit here--cassis, red currant and blackberry--with supple texture. Yet there's serious grip, with mineral, cocoa and toast notes as well, all framed by firm yet well-integrated tannins. This should develop nicely. Drink now through 2006. 20,150 cases made. —JM

Wine: Castello di Querceto Chianti Classico Riserva +
Notes: Wonderful aromas of spice, blackberry and incense. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, long finish. Very well-crafted. Best after 2003. 12,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Bodegas Emilio Moro Ribera del Duero +
Notes: Beautifully polished, complex but balanced, this impressive red shows ripe fruit, judicious oak and a vibrant sense of place. Not overly muscular, but finely proportioned and deeply flavored. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported. —TM

Elegant, vivid and sophisticated, showing pure fruit flavors of blackberry and blueberry, accented by vanilla from oak and kept lively by crisp acidity. Well-proportioned and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported. —TM

Wine: Franciscan Oakville Estate Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley +
Notes: Quite reliant on jazzy oak, but it's also quite rich and concentrated, with appealing currant, black cherry, anise, mineral and leathery notes, finishing with pretty coffee ground notes. Drink now through 2009. 88,858 cases made. —JL

Intense coffee, spice and ripe berries on the nose. Full-bodied, with lots of soft and silky tannins and a long, long fruity, berry and vanilla aftertaste. Reminds me of the excellent 1989, which I am still drinking with relish. Excellent value here. Best after 2007. 24,665 cases made. —JS

Plump and generous, a deep, plush-textured red that bursts with plum, blackberry, vanilla, white pepper and cream flavors, which echo beautifully as the flavors last and last on the gorgeous finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2015. 20,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Byron Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley +
Notes: Smooth, rich and concentrated, with a tasty core of plum, blackberry and wild berry shaded by toasty, smoky oak. It all comes together on the finish, where it turns complex and plush. Drink now through 2007. 9,213 cases made. —JL

Wine: Altos de Medrano Malbec Mendoza Viña Hormigas Reserva +
Notes: Serious juice here, with deep, vivid purple color, loads of plum, boysenberry and blackberry fruit, extra layers of meat, mineral and toast, and a terrific velvety texture despite the dense, muscular tannins. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made. —JM
Light in texture, but the flavors pile up nicely, growing from delicate berry to rich plum and spice as they fill the mouth on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 16,373 cases made. —HS

Lovely stuff, it manages to be rich in flavor yet delicate in texture, offering raspberry and mint-scented cherry and peppery spice flavors, which linger effortlessly on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,100 cases made. —HS

Wine: Rosemount Shiraz Mudgee Hill of Gold +
Notes: Brighter, livelier and juicier than most Australian Shiraz, a vibrant wine with crisp blackberry, plum and vaguely leafy-herbal flavors that persist beautifully on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 23,000 cases made. —HS

Etched in stone. Dry and tightly wound, this conjures up a limestone cliff after a thunderstorm. Quince and peach also mingle in its rocky depths. Firm and concentrated, this is for rock hounds. Best from 2005 through 2012. 1,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: Sea Smoke Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Botella +
Notes: Dark, firm, rich and intense, with lots of concentration to the black cherry, blackberry, fresh earth and blueberry jam flavors. Well-focused, with mouthcoating, integrated tannins and a long, pure, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 536 cases made. —JL

A luscious, velvety texture carries plum, toast, spice and licorice flavors in this generous red. Tannins are big, ripe and round, the finish sweet and spicy. Drink now through 2012. 4,700 cases made. —TM

Loads of rich flavors yet with a sense of elegance and finesse, with layers of ripe, spicy, apple, pear and buttery notes, finishing with lively, well-integrated acidity and a burst of flavor on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made. —JL

A gorgeous wine. This shows beautiful perfumes of ripe fruit, with hints of spicy oak and dried flowers. Full-bodied, with superfine, silky tannins and a long, long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 18,180 cases made. —JS

This dark red impresses with its solid structure and good balance. The flavors are muted now, but the concentration is evident, and a core of wild plum and toast notes will open with time. Best from 2004 through 2009. 10,000 cases made. —TM

Dark, rich and polished, with complex, concentrated currant, tobacco, olive, bell pepper and blackberry flavors. Finishes with a flash of spicy, toasty oak and ripe, integrated tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2011. 9,000 cases made. —JL

Starts off dark and dense, but quickly finds a sense of elegance that lets the pepper- and licorice-scented blackberry and cherry flavors come sailing through, echoing beautifully on the firm, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2010. 17,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Nigl Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal +
Notes: A floral white, delicate and graceful, this combines apple, citrus and mineral flavors with a slim yet medium-bodied frame. Its silky texture and seamlessness reveal its pedigree. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle-Dr. Loosen Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica +
Notes: Ripe, fresh and juicy, with immense generosity, brimming with mineral-scented, honey-kissed apricot and peach flavors, supple on the finish and nicely laced with just enough acidity to keep it long and lively. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva +
Notes: Gorgeous aromas of plum, blackberry and violet. Full-bodied, with bright, delicious fruit and refined tannins. Long, long finish. As a Chianti Classico riserva should be. Drink now through 2008. 3,300 cases made. —JS

Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 Syrah Walla Walla Valley Seven Hills Vineyard +
Notes: A racy, wild, generous Syrah, juicy with lively acidity balancing the raucous blackberry, plum and a whiff of mineral and gamy character that wafts through the long, aromatic finish. Tannins are subdued, and it all holds together nicely. Drink now through 2010. 960 cases made. —HS
Intense and lively, with freshly squeezed lime and green apple flavors that are enlivened by acidity, giving this a long, fruity, cleansing aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 6,340 cases made. —JL

Terrific juice, pure and driven, with red and black currant, cassis, bittersweet chocolate, graphite and espresso flavors. Serious depth, with the fruit coursing through the finish despite its youthful tightness. A classy wine. Cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases imported. —JM

Wine: Vincent Girardin Chassagne-Montrachet Morgeot Vieilles Vignes +
Notes: Fat and rich, with a botrytislike dried apricot, dried peach, fig and honey character. Has the opulence of a grand cru. Silky. Full-bodied and harmonious, but not as long as it could be on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made. —PM

Beautifully crafted, exquisitely balanced and rich in currant, exotic spice and ripe blackberry fruit. Turns spicy and exhibits pretty mocha-scented oak, with a long, broad, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 5,320 cases made. —JL

This excellent wine is a relatively good value for the quality. Intense aromas of berry, spice and pepper follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a rich finish. Best after 2004. 5,800 cases made. —JS

Wine: Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District +
Notes: Beautifully crafted, with wonderful, complex aromas and a smooth, seductive texture. Layers of currant, cedar, herb, coffee, olive and mocha, turning remarkably elegant and supple. Ripe, well-integrated tannins give it a long, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2010. —JL

Wine: Ojai Syrah California Roll Ranch Vineyard +
Notes: Simply delicious, overflowing with flavor. Inky dark, ripe, rich and plush, with a load of jammy plum, blackberry, wild berry and spicy aromatics. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and a gush of fruit. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made. —JL

Beautifully crafted, sleek, rich and refined, with a tight, elegant beam of spicy pear, citrus, honey and fresh, clean earth. Tapered on the finish, where the flavors are long and detailed. Nary a trace of oak in this classy debut Chardonnay from HdV. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made. —JL
Beautiful and elegant, with silky, ripe fruit. Medium-bodied, with medium, fine tannins and a caressing finish. Very fine. Excellent value. Best after 2007. 5,400 cases made. —JS

Tightly wound and firmly concentrated, it opens up to unveil a wealth of rich, exotic spices, with beefy bay leaf, earth and mineral scents to a dense, chewy core of beefy currant, blackberry and new leather, finishing with espresso, mocha and vanilla flavors that make it quite enticing. It should only get better in the next year. Best from 2005 through 2012. 430 cases made. —JL

Wine: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso +
Notes: Wild berry, cherry and floral aromas to this Brunello. Full-bodied, with big, silky tannins and loads of exciting fruit. Lively, yet refined. These wines are a joy to taste. Giuseppe Bianchini is a master in the vineyards. Best after 2004. 3,900 cases made. —JS

Lovely richness, fleshing out the honey, litchi and grapefruit peel notes. It gets good support from a moderately firm structure, with a touch of bitterness shoring up the long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases made. —BS

A big wine, with fascinating aromas of black licorice, berry and toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of ripe fruit and velvety, fruit-coated tannins. Long finish. Easily the best wine from this producer this year due to the richness and balance. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made. —JS

Like lemon curd on the nose, turning to honey and caramel. Full-bodied and very sweet, with fantastic concentration of ripe and botrytized fruit, yet balanced and refined. Electric acidity. Lasts for minutes on the palate. This is absolutely mind-blowing. This is the greatest young Sauternes I have ever tasted. Best after 2010. 12,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Casa Lapostolle Clos Apalta Colchagua Valley +
Notes: Stunning purity, with concentrated plum, boysenberry and raspberry fruit that just glides across the palate, buttressed by superfine yet muscular tannins. Suave toast, coconut butter and spice notes along with alluring chocolate and black tea hints chime in on the long finish. A superb combination of fruit and elegance. Drink now through 2009. 4,885 cases made. —JM

A stunning effort. Wonderful fragrant aromas of violets, vanilla bean, espresso and tiers of black cherry and blackberry fruit. This is an unusually fruity and complex wine that is quite reliant on oak for some of its flavors, but also a wealth of rich, concentrated dark berry flavors, finishing with a long, luxurious finish. Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made. —JL

Stick your nose in this and it says something—"I am special." Deep and generous aromas of blackberries, fresh tobacco and minerals. It's full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and a superlong finish. Like a fine cashmere sweater. Best after 2010. 22,000 cases made. —JS

Cassis and cocoa notes follow through on the palate of this voluptuous, international-style red. Mouthcoating tannins can't overwhelm the ripe, expressive flavors of cassis, blackberry and kirsch. The wine is fresh and focused, and the long finish echoes with vanilla and Eastern spices. Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Fontodi Colli della Toscana Centrale Flaccianello +
Notes: Monumental, with masses of blackberry, coffee, berry and cherry aromas. Full-bodied, with layers of ripe tannins. Goes on and on. Builds on the palate. I have never tasted a greater wine from here. Better than 1997. Best after 2007. 4,000 cases made. —JS

Wonderful balance and sense of elegance, it offers vivid ripe fruit flavors that are rich and complex, with spicy black cherry, blackberry, pomegranate, herb and sage notes that add flavor dimensions and complexity. Firm, but ripe tannins add structure, allowing the fruit to push through. Drink now through 2009. 48,000 cases made. —JL

Wine: Greg Norman Estates Shiraz South Eastern Australia Reserve +
Notes: Dark, deep and powerful, an explosive wine, positively vibrating with ultraripe raspberry, blackberry, licorice, sweet peppers and spices, all balanced with juicy acidity and finishing with remarkable harmony and tremendous length. A real knockout. Best after 2006. 800 cases made. —HS

Wine: Paolo Scavino Barolo Bric dël Fiasc +
Notes: Very, very ripe fruit, with strawberries and plums galore. Turns to Indian spices and cedar. Full-bodied, with an exquisite palate of ultraripe tannins that turn to velvet. Long, long finish. Cashmere. Great from barrel, great from bottle. This is the best Bric dël Fiasc ever. Best after 2010. 875 cases made. —JS

Gorgeous aromas of honey, passion fruit, mango and candied lemon rind. Full-bodied and ultraconcentrated, yet balanced and refined. It lasts for minutes on the palate. This has just about everything in the right place. Stunning. Best after 2009. 6,665 cases made. —JS

Wine: Peter Michael Les Pavots Knights Valley +
Notes: Seductive spicy blackberry, floral and licorice flavors are simply fantastic in a wine that's rich in flavor yet delicately balanced and elegantly styled. This magnificent young wine gushes with ripe, fleshy Cabernet flavors, and while the flavors run deep, it's the balance and suppleness of the tannins that let you savor the wealth of perfectly ripened grapes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,853 cases made. —JL

This brick house of a wine shows plenty of Pauillac-like hints of iron, dried currant and cigar smoke, but also has layers of Chilean loam, blackberry, plum, spice and minerals. A powerful performance in a powerful vintage. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2005 through 2012. 15,000 cases made. —JM

Wonderful aromas of blackberries, raspberries and fresh tobacco, with a hint of exotic fruit. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Very silky indeed. A gorgeous, seductive, classy red. A monument to Tuscany. Layers and layers of fruit and tannins. Perhaps the greatest Tuscan red ever. Best after 2012. 2,670 cases made. —JS

Brilliant yellow-gold color, superrich and multifaceted, with layers of rich, creamy fig, citrus, pear and honeysuckle. This deliciously full-blown wine is deeply concentrated, finishing with a long, persistent aftertaste, picking up a cedar, smoke and toasty oak nuance that adds another dimension. Drink now through 2009. 960 cases made. —JL

Wine: Leeuwin Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series +
Notes: Seamless, harmonious and seductive, its gorgeous cascade of pear, pineapple, guava, nectarine and subtle spice aromas and flavors flowing across the palate like a babbling brook in a Japanese garden. Amazingly refined and built to last, but it feels utterly complete already. The finish just sails on and on. Drink now through 2020. 4,500 cases made. —HS

Sensuous, aromatic and harmonious, evoking toast, candied citrus, hazelnut and mineral aromas and flavors; reminiscent of a white Burgundy, with bubbles. Impeccably balanced and finely textured, the finish echoes with toast and candied fruit notes. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases imported. —BS

Wine: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo +
Notes: A tight and chewy wine, with full body and lots of raisin and spice character. Impressive, ripe tannins. Thick and powerful; needs time in the bottle. From one of the most serious producers in Montalcino now. Best after 2007. 21,660 cases made. —JS

Wine: Paul Hobbs Chardonnay Russian River Valley +
Notes: You won't find many Chardonnays in this class. Ultrarich and multidimensional, with a fabulous array of creamy flavors built around a core of fig, apricot, crème brûlée and roasted marshmallows. Full-bodied, yet elegant and concentrated, it weaves the tapestry of flavors to a long, rich, graceful finish. Drink now through 2009. 2,016 cases made. —JL

Wine: Beaux Frères Pinot Noir Willamette Valley The Beaux Frères Vineyard +
Notes: Big and ripe, a mouthwatering wine with tingly acidity bringing harmony to a wash of plum, blackberry, cherry and dusky spice flavors, which persist on the fine-grained, not terribly tannic finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,599 cases made. —HS
A rich, stylish wine with concentrated layers of ripe fig, apricot and honeysuckle, turning elegant and polished, with a long, rich finish. Drink now through 2006. 64,000 cases made. —JL

Big and powerful, brimming with tarry, spicy black cherry, dark plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Rich and gooey like a warm flourless chocolate cake, yet it finds a plush balance that keeps it from veering off into heaviness. This has grace, harmony and refinement, without losing an ounce of power. Drink now through 2025. 600 cases imported. —HS

Powerful, intense and concentrated red, with robust flavors of dark plum, dark cherry and spice, all tightly wrapped but generous and deep. Smoke and dark chocolate notes emerge on the long, refined finish. A stunning red from the wilds of the Douro. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Francesca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca and Tinto Cão. Best from 2005 through 2008. 2,160 cases made. —KM

Lithe in texture, vivid in flavor, with a burst of black cherry, currant, huckleberry, cedar, vanilla and exotic spice flavors that hang together beautifully. Rich from the first sip, and the flavors persist impressively. Yum. Drink now through 2012. 1,350 cases made. —HS

Wine: Beringer Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release +
Notes: A superrich, multifaceted Chardonnay brimming with exotic ripe pear, fig and honeysuckle flavors overlaid by smoky, toasty, roasted marshmallow oak, finishing with a long, saturated, unctuous aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made. —JL

This pulls no punches, with lots of grilled hazelnut, matchstick and piecrust aroma followed by ripe pear, fig and melon flavors. Long, smoky finish delivers another wave of fruit. Drink now through 2005. 15,000 cases made. —JM

Wine: Concha y Toro Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Don Melchor +
Notes: Terrific personality, with prune, cocoa, loam, mineral, dark currant, blackberry, tar and sanguine flavors that don't quit. Well-structured, with fine balance and harmony already and a very long finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 15,200 cases made. —JM

Golden yellow. Butterscotch and vanilla, with hints of ripe apples. Full-bodied, with lots of sweetness and a spicy apricot and honey aftertaste. Excellent concentration and balance. Loads of botrytis character on the finish. Intense. Hard not to drink now because it's so luscious and rich. Best after 2008. 11,665 cases made. —JS
Classy, elegant red with plum, berry and soft mineral character. Medium- to full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long minerally finish. Best after 2005. 2,055 cases made. —JS

Dark and dense, this very powerful Châteauneuf oozes dark chocolate, black currant, tar, mineral, grilled beef and roasted chestnut flavors that just won't quit. Yet despite its exotic range of flavors, it has a pure, silky core of fruit that remains steadfast through the extremely long finish. An awesome young wine. Best from 2006 through 2024. 2,350 cases made. —JM

This wine shows an incredible concentration of fruit, with loads of berries and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, with soft and silky tannins and lots of smoky character. Goes for a long time on the finish. Always a benchmark for the region. Best after 2005. 55,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Henri Bourgeois Pouilly-Fumé La Porte de L'Abbaye +
Notes: This offers layers of streamlined flint, lime, lemon curd, smoke, green almond and dried herbs, all running through a long finish that never breaks stride. Drink now through 2008. 12,500 cases made. —JM

Beautiful spice, berry, plum and raspberry character with hints of spices. Full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. This is always one of the greatest producers of Brunello and 1999 is no different. If you couldn't get his 1997 (97 points), buy this. Best after 2006. 2,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Cougar Crest Syrah Walla Walla Valley +
Notes: Ripe, beautifully focused and generous, a delicious mouthful of blackberry, cherry, blueberry, plum and exotic spice flavors that just don't quit, hinting at smoke and meat on the lithe, elegant finish. Impressive for its balance of power and grace. Drink now through 2012. 1,360 cases made. —HS

Wine: Columbia Crest Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve +
Notes: Ripe, polished, opulent style teems with spicy black cherry, raspberry, black olive, bay leaf and sweet spice flavors, which echo against the superfine tannins on the long, generous finish. Drink now through 2013. 4,000 cases made. —HS

Wonderful spice and currant aromas to this young wine. Full-bodied, with super well-integrated, refined tannins. Long caressing finish. This is very, very silky. Just like from barrel. Cos is on top of it now. Best after 2008. 17,705 cases made. —JS

Wine: Two Hands Shiraz McLaren Vale Angel's Share +
Notes: Not a huge mouthful, but it unfolds its flavors and builds up intensity as the blackberry, plum, cedar and floral pepper flavors persist onto the long, generous finish. Best from 2007 through 2015. 2,200 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Marqués de Griñon Syrah Viño de Mesa de Toledo Dominio de Valdepusa +
Notes: Powerful aromas of anise, game and tar may be too strong for some, but they morph into ripe blackberry, cassis, espresso, black pepper, licorice and mineral flavors on the palate. The texture is plush, the tannins massive but well-integrated, and the fruit sails on the finish. Ambitious red in the full-blown international style. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Worthy Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Sophia's Cuvee +
Notes: Appealing for its exuberant display of ripe, fleshy blackberry and wild berry fruit. It adds a pretty touch of floral and cedar nuances before revealing its depth, richness and concentration on a long, persistent, impressive finish that keeps the flavors lively and flowing. Drink now through 2012. 1,375 cases made. —JL

Wine: Pride Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve +
Notes: Phenomenal wine, with seductive spicy, mocha and chocolaty oak aromas and ripe, rich, plush currant and blackberry flavors that are deeply concentrated; reveals extra layers of complexity and depth and finishes with a potent burst of ripe flavors. No denying its tannic strength, but this wine packs a wallop of fruit as well. Drink now through 2012. 1,180 cases made. —JL

Bright, juicy and lively with blackberry, huckleberry, white pepper and a refined floral character that melds beautifully through the finish, and the tremendous aftertaste just doesn't quit. A stylish Shiraz that should keep giving for years. Best from 2006 through 2015. 5,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Rosenblum Zinfandel Paso Robles Richard Sauret Vineyard +
Notes: Intense and rich in flavor, with smoky, toasty oak wrapped snugly around a core of plum and blackberry fruit, turning complex as they fold together on the finish, ending with a chocolate espresso bean aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 2,858 cases made. —JL

Ripe, round and decadent, plush in texture, oozing with tarry, chocolaty plum and black cherry flavors that linger beautifully. Picks up all kinds of spicy notes as the finish goes on and on. Should only get deeper with age. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made. —HS

The nose of this wine evokes crushed Nebbiolo, with hints of fresh flowers and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with incredibly round, soft tannins. Long, velvety finish. Voluptuous. Azelia has come into its own. Serve this to the nonbelievers. Best after 2008. 1,040 cases made. —JS

Wine: Araujo Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Eisele Vineyard +
Notes: An exceptional bottling that offers a veritable explosion of hay, lemon blossom, grass, melon and nectarine notes. Tangy acidity, supple cream tones, anise and mineral nuances weave through a finish of superior depth and dimension. Doesn't get much better than this. Drink now through 2006. 1,300 cases made. —JL

Tremendous; dark, dense, rich and concentrated, with layers of beef carpaccio, blackberry, wild berry, exotic peppery spices and touches of tar and herbs, finishing with a long, rich, detailed finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,450 cases made. —JL

Black cherries with fresh basil on the nose open to a full-bodied palate, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. A solid wine with a good core of fruit and tannins. Best after 2008. 10,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Sebastiani Chardonnay Sonoma County Appellation Selection +
Notes: Impeccable balance, richness and complexity, with tiers of spicy pear, floral, honey, vanilla and toasty oak and a long, persistent finish that echoes hazelnut and spice. Drink now through 2009. 26,500 cases made. —JL

Gorgeous, silky and harmonious, offering orange blossom, honey and beeswax aromas and flavors. Lightweight, elegant and vibrant, it carries its sweetness with poise, ending with freshness and a long aftertaste of honey. Drink now through 2020. 1,250 cases made. —BS

Rock solid, with thoroughly ripe blackberry and boysenberry fruit augmented by toast, spice, mineral and loam. Dense and plush, but vivid and defined through the finely stitched finish. Drink now through 2007. 33,000 cases made. —JM

Wine: Domaines Schlumberger Riesling Alsace Les Princes Abbés +
Notes: This is lush and though it starts out off-dry, the racy structure emerges midpalate, driving the floral, peach and mineral flavors to a long, dry conclusion. It really sings on the finish today, with a long, smoky aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases imported. —BS

Wine: Pago de los Capellanes Ribera del Duero Crianza +
Notes: This distinctive red is graceful on the palate, but has an intensity that amplifies and focuses its ripe fruit and toasty oak flavors, driving them across the palate and into the long, long finish. It's not showy, but the longer you linger, the more it delivers. Drink now through 2015. 7,600 cases made. —TM

Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle-Dr. Loosen Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica +
Notes: Graceful and subtle, with lively support for its stony green apple and delicate apricot flavor, finishing dry but with a caramel note that makes it all the more intriguing. Impressive for the way it knits together. Drink now through 2008. 18,000 cases made. —HS

Ripe and open-textured, rife with cherry, currant and blueberry jam flavors, subtlety shaded with spicy, slightly smoky overtones that linger along with the fruit on a very persistent finish. A hint of melted wax that is intriguing as well. Best from 2005 through 2015. 8,000 cases made. —HS
Focused and dense plum and blackberry fruit on the nose. Full-bodied, jammy and rich. Soft tannins. Fruit-forward. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Ripe, rich, juicy and polished, with layers of currant, black cherry and plum that are deeply concentrated, elegant and lively. A light overlay of toasty, mocha-scented oak adds another flavor dimension, and the flavors linger on a long, zesty aftertaste. A delicious Merlot that's a worthy successor to the stellar '01. Drink now through 2009. 1,650 cases made. —JL

Excellent intensity, focus and concentration, with layers of creamy, smoky fig, citrus, pear and hazelnut. Remarkably elegant and polished, finishing with subtle, pleasing flavor nuances. Drink now through 2007. 2,937 cases made. —JL

Wine: Bodegas Terrazas de los Andes Malbec Mendoza Reserva +
Notes: Terrific core of blackberry, black fig and boysenberry fruit, with lush toast, cocoa powder and loam notes as well. Juicy and long, with a powerful finish. Jump on it. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases imported. —JM

Wine: Van Duzer Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate +
Notes: Dramatically aromatic, brimming with black cherry, hinting at smoke and spices as the flavors play against firm tannins. Needs time to soften, and then fasten your seatbelt. Best from 2006 through 2012. 4,500 cases made. —HS

Polished, focused and impressive for its pure currant and blackberry fruit, nicely shaded with hints of mineral and a whisper of red pepper. The flavors linger enticingly against fine, crisp tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 4,312 cases made. —HS

This just oozes fruit--blackberries, plums and currants--but has firm tannins to keep it from getting to gushy. Lots of tar, smoke and dark chocolate here too, with the fruit pumping through the finish. Shiraz with five percent Viognier. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases imported. —JM

Suave wine, with black and red currant fruit offset by tangy mineral and sanguine notes. Plenty of toast and spice as well, but it's all folded together in a rich, creamy package with a nice tar note on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2006. 6,000 cases made. —JM

Explosively aromatic, brimming with spice, herb and peppery character, surprisingly docile in the mouth, with lovely pear, apple, melon and mineral flavors that linger enticingly. Impeccably balanced. Drink now. 60,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Williams Selyem Pinot Noir Russian River Valley +
Notes: Wonderful fragrant aromas of flowers and ripe cherry and wild berry, which transfer over to a smooth, rich, polished style that caresses the palate, turning silky and delicate. Finishes with vivid black cherry and blackberry fruit and touches of vanilla and spice. Drink now through 2008. 3,275 cases made. —JL

Wine: Columbia Crest Merlot Columbia Valley Grand Estates +
Notes: Ripe, plump and generous with its fresh cherry, dried cherry, dark plum and sweet spice flavors, nicely framed with toasty oak as the fruit persists impressively on the long finish. Drink now through 2009. 310,000 cases made. —HS

Wine: Joh. Jos. Prüm Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr +
Notes: A primer for terroir. This screams slate, along with peach and lime flavors, all finely matched to a delicate yet tensile structure. Terrific intensity in a light frame, ending with an aftertaste of peach and smoke. Drink now through 2015. 1,600 cases made. —BS

Expressive aromas of black currants and coffee follow through on the muscular palate, amplified by anise, tobacco and mineral notes. When the tannins give way, the finish is clean and long. A full-throttle red that achieves power without ever losing control. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon, Carignane and Tempranillo. Best from 2006 through 2014. 1,500 cases imported. —TM

Incredible aromas of flowers, currants, blackberries, and minerals. Full-bodied, with a supersolid core of fruit, incredibly finely knit tannins and a finish that goes on and on. This is really superb. Much better than from barrel. Giscours is really going places. Best after 2009. 26,665 cases made. —JS

Wine: Sea Smoke Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Southing +
Notes: Ultraripe, rich and plush, with concentrated, detailed black cherry, wild berry and plummy flavors framed by firm toasty, cedary oak, and finishing with a long, intense, persistent aftertaste offering a wealth of flavors and plenty of rich minerally tannins. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases made. —JL

Intense and seductive red, with loads of dark cherry, blackberry and kirsch flavors spread out over a powerful and robust frame. Mouthcoating tannins give it added muscle. Smoky notes mix with dark chocolate on the long, fresh, mineral-laden finish. Tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2009. 1,170 cases imported. —KM

Plenty of soft and spicy character with hints of black pepper, even eucalyptus. Medium-bodied, with round and velvety tannins and a long finish. Very well done. Tuscan enologist Luca d'Attoma has turned this place around. Drink now through 2008. 11,600 cases made. —JS

Lots of black fruit, violet and mineral character. Full-bodied, with densely packed fruit on a rounded, expansive palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruity, minerally finish. Delicious now, but should open up even more. A great value at this score. Best after 2004. 22,500 cases made. —JS

Wine: Castello di Querceto Chianti Classico Riserva +
Notes: Delicious, with blackberry and chocolaty character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh, minerally finish. This is serious Chianti. Drink now. 8,330 cases made. —JS

Alluring spice notes of cinnamon and clove add complexity to the ripe plum and sweet vanilla flavors in this rich red. It's balanced and expressive, not overly powerful, but brings you back for another sip. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported. —TM

Wine: Valentín Bianchi Cabernet Sauvignon San Rafael-Argentina Famiglia +
Notes: The lush cassis and raspberry fruit is surrounded by cocoa, spice and toast notes. The fruit really pumps through the finish, offset by a mineral note that adds further dimension. Elegant and well put together. Drink now through 2008. 6,000 cases made. —JM

Wine: Columbia Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Otis Vineyard David Lake Signature Series +
Notes: Smooth and polished, an elegant red with depth of flavor that sneaks up on you. Currant, blackberry, smoky spice and dried tomato flavors compete for attention, building in intensity as the fine tannins subside on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2015. 2,380 cases made. —HS

Wine: San Fabiano Calcinaia Chianti Classico Cellole Riserva +
Notes: Phenomenal nose, with complex smoky, tarry, licoricelike red fruit aromas. Full-bodied, with added tobacco and vanilla coming through on the palate, with silky tannins and a long, minerally finish. One of the best Chianti Classicos I've ever tasted. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made. —JS

Full-bodied, with loads of dark plum, blackberry, dark cherry and spice flavors. This is a finely sculpted red that packs plenty of punch as well. Espresso and dark chocolate notes linger on the finish. Tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2009. 20,950 cases made. —KM

Excellent balance, richness and complexity are evident in this ripe, supple young wine. Elegant and polished, its strength lies in its delicacy and finesse, with potent currant, cassis, spice and pretty floral aromatics. On the finish, the flavors are long and persistent. Drink now through 2012. 3,100 cases made. —JL

Wine: Josef Leitz Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Magdalenenkreuz +
Notes: A tantalizing mix of apricot, orange, rose and mineral meshed in a creamy texture, all backed by vibrant acidity. Concentrated and long, with a crispness at the end that will become integrated with time. Best from 2006 through 2015. 1,000 cases made. —BS

Wine: Wolf Blass Shiraz Barossa Gold Label +
Notes: Round, velvety and generous with its smoky blackberry and tar flavors, gently balanced with tangy acidity, but the emphasis is on the berry and spice flavors that linger on the finish. Not a typical Barossa Shiraz, but it's a honey. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases imported. —HS

Wine: Bodegas Palacio Rioja Cosme Palacio y Hermanos +
Notes: Expressive and alluring. This modern red shows a plush texture and ripe fruit flavors of blackberry and plum, with pretty oak accents and well-integrated tannins. It has depth, but remains graceful on the palate. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made. —TM

Wine: Domaine du Pégaü Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée Réservée +
Notes: Super, with ripe plum and blackberry fruit supported by notes of briar, brick dust, tar and bacony smoke. Rich yet racy, with a powerful yet perfumy fruit- and dried herb-driven finish. Shows a lot now, but built for the long haul. Drink now through 2016. 5,500 cases made. —JM

Great character in this throwback wine, with a thicket of dark currant, blackberry, tar, beef, chestnut, mineral and sanguine flavors. Long finish is etched with bittersweet chocolate and another layer of really ripe blackberry fruit. Impressive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2008. 3,080 cases made. —JM

Very refined, with a lemony cast to this firmly structured, minerally white. It's concentrated, elegant and beautifully balanced. It requires time, however, to integrate all its components. Best from 2006 through 2012. 7,500 cases made. —BS

Wine: Domaine des Baumard Savennières Clos du Papillon +
Notes: Plump, with lots of fig and quince fruit; pretty hints of spice and minerals in the background while the fruit takes center stage. Nice dry, minerally finish keeps it honest and bodes well for cellaring. Drink now through 2015. 2,330 cases made. —JM

Delicious for its core of fleshy roasted plum, wild berry and black cherry, this wine holds its focus while picking up a nice touch of beefy, peppery flavors, only to return to its core of pure Syrah, ending with a nice lift in flavor and ripe, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2009. 2,310 cases made. —JL

Wine: Villa Mt. Eden Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Grand Reserve +
Notes: A tremendous value. Complex, with intense spice, pear, citrus, baked apple and hazelnut flavors that are both concentrated and elegantly styled, finishing with a pretty burst of fruit flavors. Drink now through 2007. 13,000 cases made. —JL

Subtle note of honeysuckle and straw, but the palate explodes with mineral, citrus peel, chive flower, flint and gooseberry flavors. Then fresh, racy acidity supports a long, flinty finish. Ideal with Crottin de Chavignol. Drink now through 2006. 1,250 cases imported. —JM

Terrific aromas to this wine, with violets, spices, cinnamon and berries. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a lovely ripe fruit and vanilla aftertaste. Very integrated and refined. Shows class. Langoa is very underrated. Another winner from the Barton family. Best after 2008. 8,000 cases made. —JS

Very fresh on the nose, with sliced plums and hints of blackberries. Full-bodied, with a solid core of ripe yet clean fruit and very silky tannins. Very polished. Best after 2007. 5,000 cases made. —JS

Ripe and plump, generous with its spicy, mocha-scented cherry and blackberry flavors, persisting smoothly through the long, harmonious finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 19,000 cases made. —HS
Beautiful aromas of mineral, apple and light honey with just hints of lemon rind. Full-bodied, with lively fruit and a long, long finish. A beauty. Drink now. 13,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Feudi di San Gregorio Falanghina Sannio +
Notes: Aromas of lemons and rhubarb turn to minerals, melons, and honey. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely acidity and a long, ripe fruit aftertaste. Delicious. One of the best values in Italian white. Drink now. 70,000 cases made. —JS

Wine: Rosemount Chardonnay Hunter Valley Show Reserve +
Notes: Supple, welcoming style bathes the mouth in pretty pear, quince, hazelnut and delicate spice flavors, beautifully knit to persist on the open finish. Has balance and style without showing off. Drink now through 2012. 16,000 cases imported. —HS

Intense and vibrant, with a firm tannic backbone to the core of earthy blackberry and wild berry fruit. Tightens on the finish, with a hint of clove and cedary oak, at times flexing its muscles yet also offering concentration and depth. Drink now through 2009. 20,400 cases made. —JL
Fantastic white, with lively pineapple, honey and apricot aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with bright acidity and a long finish. Excellent value. Drink now. 8,500 cases made. —JS

Smooth and round, seductively plush but not overwhelming in flavor, keeping its musky cherry, plum and tobacco flavors in harmony as they sail into the long finish. Drink now through 2008. 19,063 cases made. —HS

Wine: Georges Duboeuf Moulin-à-Vent Domaine des Rosiers +
Notes: Great core of blackberry and currant fruit, with ample chocolate, spice and briar notes. This is structured like its colleagues, but manages to end on a lush, creamy note. Drink now through 2005. 9,000 cases made. —JM

Lively, generous and ripe, layering its blueberry, currant, sassafras and espresso flavors that linger effectively on the finish, deftly balanced with just the right twinge of acidity. Drink now through 2009. 50,000 cases made. —HS

A rich, polished, seductive style with layers of complexity built around a dense, concentrated mix of currant, blackberry, plum and exotic mocha- and cedar-scented oak. This mouthcoating young wine is powerful yet elegant and deftly balanced, finishing with a long, succulent aftertaste. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best from 2008 through 2014. 15,000 cases made. —JL

Lilting and perfumy, with a grace that belies the vintage, this offers layer upon layer of raspberry, boysenberry, floral, mineral and mocha flavors that glide to a long, silky, refined finish. So seductive, you almost miss how powerful it is--a masterful job of winemaking. Drink now through 2030. 7,300 cases made. —JM

Wine: Rosenblum Zinfandel Rockpile Rockpile Road Vineyard +
Notes: Ripe, delicious and exuberant; rich with layers of wild berry, blackberry and raspberry shaded by light, toasty oak. Finishes with a fantastic burst of fruit and ripe, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2009. 4,973 cases made. —JL

Wine: Concha y Toro Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Don Melchor +
Notes: Gorgeous nose of black currant preserves and freshly roasted coffee, with a powerful yet very silky palate of cassis, plum, blackberry, loam, mineral and dark chocolate flavors that glide through a superlong finish. Don't be deceived by its seeming accessibility though--there's some iron-clad structure underneath for the long haul as well. Drink now through 2012. 13,500 cases made. —JM

Wine: Crocker & Starr Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley +
Notes: This wine offers a wide swath of intense fig, yellow apple, hay and ripe yellow melon flavors, giving it a rich mouthfeel and impeccible balance, with peppery spice, fine lingering richness and lemon-lime tanginess that sails on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,199 cases made. —JL

Wine: Paolo Scavino Barolo Bric dël Fiasc +
Notes: Intense aromas of licorice, berries and tobacco with just a hint of citrus. Full-bodied, with an excellent intensity of fruit and a long, silky finish. Juicy and rich. Always classic in a top year. Best after 2008. 800 cases made. —JS

Wine: Barossa Valley Estate Shiraz Barossa Valley E&E Black Pepper +
Notes: Dark, juicy and profound, with layer upon layer of flavor seamlessly knit into a cohesive whole, offering dark berry, black cherry, exotic spice, black pepper and licorice that sail through the long, vivid finish. Has tremendous style, intensity and a long life ahead of it. Best from 2010 through 2022. 1,200 cases made. —HS

Wine: Tenimenti Luigi d'Alessandro Syrah Cortona Il Bosco +
Notes: Powerful aromas of crushed black fruits, pepper and wet earth; just a hint of roasted meat. Full-bodied, chewy and rich, with a long, long finish. This is a fantastic Syrah. Like a great Hermitage. Best after 2008. 3,000 cases made. —JS

Amazingly rich and complex, with flavor to burn, this wine stacks up a dense core of wild berry, currant and blackberry fruit and then fairly smothers it with intense smoky, toasty, chocolaty oak. While immense and concentrated, this wine is also very well-balanced and the finish echoes fruit and oak, on and on. In this style, few can rival it. Drink one now; cellar a few. Drink now through 2012. 1,400 cases made. —JL

Breathtaking. Dense and powerful, with grilled meat and currant aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, round and chewy; a massive and exciting wine. More muscular than the 2001. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2007. 2,750 cases made. —JS

Classic Syrah aromas of beef carpaccio, pepper, wild berry, blackberry and plum. This remarkable wine is rich and concentrated, with a tight focus and an intense yet supple and integrated finish, where the flavor themes keep building on each other. Drink now through 2012. 866 cases made. —JL

A rich, massive, densely flavored Syrah, packed with syrupy currant, wild berry and boysenberry fruit, with dashes of beef, pepper and spice and a hint of cedar and earth. While the tannins are big and muscular, they have a gentleness that lets the flavors gain complexity on the finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,440 cases made. —JL

Another tremendous effort from this producer, supple and harmonious, with rich, fleshy blackberry, black cherry, plum and currant fruit that's tight and concentrated. A hint of mocha, herb and cedar add a wonderful dimension and the structure is excellent, with lively acidity and firm tannins. Best from 2006 through 2012. 2,500 cases made. —JL

Wine: Kosta Browne Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast +
Notes: This tremendously complex young Pinot gains amplitude, starting out with a delicate band of spice, vanilla, black cherry and wild berry and slowly unfolding to reveal extra layers of depth and dimension. Finishes with a rich, supple aftertaste that caresses the palate. Drink now through 2009. 790 cases made. —JL

Wine: Castello Banfi Brunello di Montalcino Poggio all'Oro Riserva +
Notes: Intense aromas of smoke and coffee open to layers of beautiful, pure fruit. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins. Absolutely gorgeous. Just like the 1997. I love it. Drink now through 2015. 5,800 cases made. —JS

Wine: Cuvée du Vatican Châteauneuf-du-Pape Sixtine Réserve +
Notes: A superb core of blackberry, boysenberry and black currant fruit stands amidst cocoa, mineral, licorice and tar flavors. Densely structured but perfectly ripe, with a long finish that cascades with both fruit and terroir. Awesome for its power and balance. Best from 2007 through 2025. 1,800 cases made. —JM

Wine: W.H. Smith Wines Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard +
